loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam H., 64, is an elderly rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham, she and her husband are able to make around US$ 1.50 per day. One of their sons works selling firewood to the local people.

Mrs. Eam would like to borrow through Kiva to increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son. This will allow her son to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to open another business selling groceries.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son

loans.name: Khaun

texts.en:
Khaun T., born in 1959, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Nim Soeun, and their six children. She is a farmer and makes $2 each day working her fields, while her husband has operated a carpentry business for a very long time and makes $4 per day. Three of their children are married and two others are too young to attend school, so it is a large family with a wide range of ages. There are no other sources of income for the family, though, so they depend very heavily on these family businesses, with the carpentry business being the main provider of family income. Khaun T. has asked CREDIT for a loan to purchase more materials and wood for her husband's carpentry business. The expansion will allow him to work with more customers and increase the family's income.

Khaun T. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Nim Soeun, is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for a carpentry business

loans.name: Gulchehrakhon

texts.en: E. Gulchehrakhon is 38 years old. She is the married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a metalworker and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She is selling women’s underwear in the local market of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today Gulchehrakhon requests $800 USD to purchase additional merchandise to increase the range of her selling goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Gulchehrakhon is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Gulchehrakhon’s business.

loans.use: Gulchehrakhon would like to purchase new women's underwear to resell.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay H., 56, and her husband are rice farmers residing with two of their children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where they typically make around $1.30 per day. Their family income is supplemented by two children employed as garment workers. 

Farming has been difficult this past year due to high inflation and poor weather conditions. Most of the provinces are without irrigation systems, rendering the farmers vulnerable to crop failure if rainfall is inadequate.  Lay is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 for two purposes:  to invest $400 in her farm by purchasing a water pump and fertilizer, and $600 to create a grocery-selling business. She is confident that these investments will enable her to increase the family’s daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer, and to create a grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar baji is the wife of A. M. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a six-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her first two sons and her daughters are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Sarwar baji's husband has a trading business. He buys leather and animal skins from different cities and resells them in Kasur. People buy this material from him to make different types of things, such as shoes, school bags, and hand bags. He has been in this profession for the last 15 years. Sarwar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Sarwar baji successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy material (leather and animal skins) to expand her husband's trading business.

loans.use: To buy material (leather and animal skins) to expand her husband's trading business.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
Begum baji is the wife of H. A. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last ten years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Begum baji's husband is a milk seller and has fifteen years of experience in the profession. Begum baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Begum baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng C., 25, is the mother of one little child and they live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She typically makes around US$3.50 in profits per day selling sugar palm and fermented fish in the market. Her husband is an incense stick maker in the village. He normally makes US$2.50 per day. Every month Mrs. Cheng needs to spend around US$60 on food and US$30 on utility. She is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, of US$500 to increase the amount of sugar palm and fermented fish she can sell. In the future, she plans to breed animals to double her family's income.

loans.use: Cheng would like to increase the amount of sugar palm and fermented fish she can sell.

loans.name: Bakhtawar

texts.en:
Bakhtawar baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. None of her children go to school. Bakhtawar baji's husband is a milk seller with thirty years of experience in the profession and a good reputation in the community. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Bakhtawar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton Y., 30, is a widow residing with her mother in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where she has a business selling sugar palm that earns her $10 in revenue each day. She collects sugar palm in her village and then sells it in Phnom Penh. 

In order to increase profits, Ton is requesting a loan to purchase sugar palm in larger amounts to sell in Phnom Penh. In the future, she plans to purchase a truck to transport wood for profit. 

(Ton's mother is pictured because Ton was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of sugar palm to sell in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Mrs. Chum Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eight members, is located in Ko Koah Village in Kampong Cham Province.  Mrs. Chum M. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members.  In addition, this is the third time that Mrs. Chum M. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity.  

She is a pig breeder who is now raising sixteen pigs.  Since her pigs now grow very fast and eat a lot, Mrs. Chum M. does not have enough money to buy pig food for them, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  Her husband, Mr. Nuon Kimkuon, is a construction worker who makes $2.50 to support his family, and it is not enough income to meet the needs of the family.  Mrs. Chum M. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of one and three. 

Two members in the village bank have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These two members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more pig food to feed her pigs while they are big.

loans.name: Choa

texts.en: Choa S. is a widow born in 1962 who raises pigs on her farm in Kampong Cham where she lives with her very young grandchild and her elderly father-in-law. She raises pigs making around US$4 each day and would like to diversify her sources of income. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$400 to purchase some grocery items to resell in her community. She has seen a need for this type of business and believes that she can find enough customers to make this a good investment. More income will allow her to increase her food consumption and can help her household improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Choa would like to purchase grocery items to resell in her community.

loans.name: Phath

texts.en: Phath S., 33, is a true entrepreneur and resides with her little child in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has had a business selling groceries and many kinds of vegetables to earn a living. She is able to make around US$5 in profit each day. In her village, there are many vendors who operate the same type of business as hers, so she needs to diversify her products to satisfy her customers. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, Kiva’s Field Partner, to increase her inventory of groceries and vegetables. In the future, she plans to breed pigs for extra profit to support the family. (Phath's mother is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To increase her stock of groceries and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran baji is the wife of C. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 27 years. She is the mother of six children. Nooran baji's husband is a milk seller with twenty years of experience in the profession. Presently, they have six goats and four buffalos at their house for milking.

Nooran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor S. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. Gulbahor is a woman determined to search for the best things in life and offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities.

Gulbahor is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this two years ago, when she moved to settle in her hometown. She devoted herself to selling women's dressing gowns, and now she is satisfied as her business provides her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary education for her two young children.

Today Gulbahor is requesting your help in getting a loan of 800 USD for a term of 6 months to add a new stock to her inventory. Your support means a great deal to Gulbahor. Please offer her your help.

loans.use: Increasing her working capital for development of business

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat baji is the wife of G. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 27 years. She is the mother of eight children.

Rahmat baji's husband has been selling milk for the last twenty years. He gets milk from his own buffalos and sells it in various milk shops in their community. He has a good relationship with his customers. They currently have five buffalos at their house. Rahmat baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Mrs. Vai Kim Huoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
NineteE. people in Tuol Ampil Village in Kampong Cham Province have formed a village bank, and Mrs. Vai K. H. is the village bank president.  They each plan to use the loan for different purposes.  For instance, Mrs. Vai K. H. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets while this business is going well.  Her husband, Mr. Ock Sothy, is a construction worker who makes $2, which not enough income to support his family.  Mrs. Vai K. H. is 22 years old and the mother of two childrE. who are both are too young to work or study because they are two years and five months old. 

One among the nineteE. members in this village bank has an end-of-term loan, and the rest have monthly payment loans.  This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Soen

texts.en:
Soen S., 32, is a mother of one child and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she and her husband, Met Ol, 45, have been raising pigs to earn a living and are able to make about $2.50 each day in profit.  Soen’s monthly expenses, including utilities, total $80. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pigs and pig feed. In the future, Soen plans to breed cows.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en:
Muazzam K. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of five much loved children. Muazzam is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example.

Muazzam has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business with financial support from her husband who has sold spare parts for automobiles for some time. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since she began it.

In order to grow her business she requests a loan of 800 US Dollars. Muazzam is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods for re-sale thus increasing her range of the goods. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase her range of inventory

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar baji is the wife of Z. I. and lives in the historic Yadgar area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 29 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter is married. The next eldest has completed her 14th level in school. Her youngest daughter has completed her 12th level in school.

Naseem Akhtar baji’s husband runs a cosmetics and movie-making business. Basically, he divides his shop into two parts: one part is based on cosmetics sales and the second part is comprised of movie-making equipment, such as cameras and film rolls. Her husband is a well-known person in the community and has run his businesses for the last 35 years. People from within and outside the community call upon him to make movies of various functions, such as birthdays and weddings. In Pakistan, people usually get married between the months of September to December, and this is the busy season for her husband. Therefore, Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy a digital movie camera for her husband so that he will be able to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie-making camera for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Channy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of ten people, is located in Ta Kret Village in Kampong Cham Province.  Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Duch C. is the village bank president and she was born in 1961.  She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year.  During the rainy season, she cultivates rice while growing vegetables in the dry season.  Her husband, Mr. Kem Touch, is a cow middleman who buys cows and re-sells them later at a better price.  Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife, Mrs. Duch C., decided to ask for a loan to buy more calves for breeding in order to re-sell.  Mrs. Duch C. has five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school. 

This village bank loan is an end-of-term loan and all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more calves for breeding in order to re-sell.

loans.name: Thi An's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị An27 tuổi, mã số 13010016 chị đã có chồng và 2 con. Chồng chị đi lao động nước ngoài. Chị và cả nhóm đã vay và trả hết vốn của chu kỳ 1. Hiện chị vay 4.704.000đ để mua gạo làm mỳ, ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi lợn. thu nhập từ làm mỳ mỗ ngày chị cũng được từ 100.000- 150.000đ.Trong nhóm chị còn có 4 thành viên cùng tham gia vay vốn

  • Đỗ Thị Mai 25 tuổi mã số 13010017 vay 4.256.000đ thời hạn vay 12 tháng để mua gỗ cho chồng làm nghề mộc
  • Nghiêm Thị Mai 39 tuổi mã số 03010018 vay 4.704.000đ thời hạn 12 tháng để mua gạo làm mỳ.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hợi 37 tuổi, mã số 13010019 vay 4.256.000đ thời hạn 12 tháng để mua cám và lợn giống. Ngoài ra 2 vợ chồng chị còn có công nông để trở hàng thuê cho những người quanh vùng
  • Nguyễn Văn Ninh 37 tuổi, mã số 13010020 vay 3360.000đ để mua cám chăn nuôi ngan vịt.Anh còn đi làm thuê hàng ngày để lấy tiền trả góp hàng tuần.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dương Thị An - 27 years old - (no. 13010016) is married and has two children. Her husband works abroad as a laborer. She and her entire group have borrowed and completely repaid their first loan. Currently, she wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND to purchase grains to make noodles and she also raises pigs. The income she gets from making noodles each day ranges from 100,000 to 150,000 VND. Her group includes four other loan participants:
  • Đỗ Thị Mai (no. 13010017) is 25 years old. She is borrowing 4,256,000 VND with a 12 month repayment period to purchase wood for her husband who is a woodsmith.
  • Nghiêm Thị Mai (no. 03010018) is 39 years old. She is borrowing 4,704,000 VND with a 12 month repayment period to buy grains for noodle-making.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hợi (no. 13010019) is 37 years old. She is borrowing 4,256,000 VND with a 12 month repayment period to purchase bran and pigs. She and her husband also work on the side providing local delivery services.
  • Nguyễn Văn Ninh (no. 13010020) is 37 years old. He is borrowing 3,360,000 VND to buy bran to raise ducks. He still works as a laborer by day to have money for the weekly repayments.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains for noodle making.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas M. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Her family lives in Khujand, Northern Tajikistan. Mukaddas sells clothes for children in the central city market. The location of her vending store is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Mukaddas has been in this trade for 2 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Mukaddas is hoping to take a loan of 300 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully this autumn season. She promises to fulfill the loan term within 12 months. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon T., 56, is a rice farmer living with his wife, Heng Rim, a housewife looking after the children and the household, in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. His farm it just enough to feed the family members, farming being an insecure livelihood due to variable weather conditions.  This couple together has five children:  two are garment workers; one has a business making incense; one is a blacksmith, and one is a grocery vendor in the market. All the children are contributing to the family's expenses. 

Thon is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for his children’s transportation. The rest of the loan will enable his son to add more products to his grocery-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a motorbike, and grocery stock.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum G., 58, a single woman living with her niece, sells various kinds of dessert outside of her home, earning a profit of about $2.50 per day. She works in her rice field as well. 

Sum is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her dessert-selling business as well as establish another business selling soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: To expand her dessert business and create another business selling drinks.

loans.name: Mrs. Khil Thavy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight members in Ta Kret village in Kampong Cham province make up a village loan.  Each member plans to use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Khil T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She is a tailor who uses cloth to process into clothes for the villagers.  Her husband, Mr. Yeang Mengleang, is a farmer.  In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because the soil in his field is infertile, which affects his crop.  Thus, his wife, Mrs. Khil T., has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her husband's field in order to produce a better crop.  Mrs. Khil T. has three children who are all attending school. 

This village bank loan is an end-of-term loan where all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her husband's field in order to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Mrs. Binn Ravy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of eight members who all live in Ta Kret village in Kampong Cham province.  Mr. Binn R. is the village bank president.  He is a security guard who makes a small salary to support his family.  His wife, Mrs. Nov Sok Hean, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family.  Since Mr. Binn R.'s family lives in an old house and poor conditions, he now wants to build a new house for his household so he decided to ask for a loan that he will combine with his savings to build a house to replace the old one.  Mr. Binn R. has one child who is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old. 

This village bank loan is an end-of-term loan where all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to combine with his saving to build a house that will replace the old one.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida baji is the wife of F. A. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last ten years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her youngest daughter is enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Rashida baji's husband is a milk seller by profession with ten years of experience in the business. Rashida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Rashida baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en:
Mukadam T. is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She lives in Khujand town and owns a small store in the local market. Mukadam has been selling children’s clothing for about 10 years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted children’s clothing at affordable prices.

Mukadam's profit from the business has increased extensively since she started her business. Mukadam has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today she is requesting a loan of 800 USD for the term of 12 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profit as a result. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Jeejan

texts.en:
Jeejan baji is the wife of C. D. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She is the mother of six sons. Jeejan baji's husband is a milk seller by profession and has been in the business for the last ten years. He is a good-natured and kind-hearted man. Jeejan baji is a housewife and helps her husband in getting milk from their buffalos.

Jeejan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Ida Ayu Putu Maskun

texts.id:
Ida Ayu Putu Maskun diusia yang sudah tua masih tetap ulet bekerja dan tekun menjalani usahanya berjualan segala macam keperluan sehari-hari seperti, ikan,  sayur, tahu, tempe, bumbu dapur dan keperluan dapur lainnya. Dibantu oleh anak dan suaminya, Ida Ayu Putu Maskun berjualan keliling disekitar desa tempat tinggalnya. Jam 05.00 pagi, Ida Ayu Putu Maskun kepasar untuk membeli segala macam keperluan untuk dagangannya. Sepulang dari pasar Ida Ayu Putu Maskun langsung berjualan hingga menjelang siang hari. Jika dagangan tidak habis maka Ida Ayu Putu Maskun akan menjualnya lagi pada sore hari. Dengan modal  Rp. 300.000.- Ida Ayu Putu Maskun bisa memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp.60.000.- jika daganganya laku terjual semua. Besarnya modal yang diperlukan membuat Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sangat  berharap bisa mendapatkan pinjaman dari Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga didesanya. Ida Ayu Putu Maskun tinggal disebuah rumah semi permanen bersama anak bungsunya dan suaminya, sedangkan anak yang lainnya semua sudah menikah. Ida Ayu Putu Maskun mempunyai 4 orang anak, 3 orang sudah menikah. 
Sisa hasil berjualannya ditabungnya untuk masa tuanya jika nanti Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sudah tidak bisa berjualan keliling lagi.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sells daily food necessities such as fish, veggie, tofu, soy bean cake, etc. She gets helps from her husband and her children in this business. She starts her day at 5 am to go to the market to buy her inventories and then she travels around her neighborhood to sell the goods. With a capital of IDR 300 thousand (around USD 30) she can earn a profit of USD 6.5 if she is able to sell all of the goods. Therefore she is hoping to get a loan money to enable her to add her capital to get more goods to sell.

Ida Ayu Putu Maskun lives in a semi permanent house with her husband and their youngest son. The other 3 sons are already married and live with their own family. She wants to be able to save her profit so she can have enough pension money when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Ghyas

texts.en:
This 23-year-old young man Ghyas U. is a resident of Ningarhar Province. Ghyas got married just five months ago, and now he and his wife live with his parents in a small house in Jalalabad city. Ghyas has three brothers, but they live with their families separately.

Ghyas has been working as a blacksmith from childhood. He was about 6 years old when he started this avocation, working with his father, and he utilized all his capability in this field and became a famous smithy. Now Ghyas and his father have a rental smithy shop in Jalalabad city. They make various things, such as knives, scissors, spades, sickles, etc.

They have 300 Afghanis (US$ 6) daily income, but Ghyas says that it's too little to cover all expenditures, because they must pay 3000 Afghanis monthly rent, and 500 more for electricity.

Therefore recently Ghyas decided to take a 50,000 Afghani loan from AFSG, to purchase some new equipment for his shop, and in that way, increase the number of his customers. Also, he wants to import some knives and scissors from Pakistan, because he thinks that Pakistani goods have a good market and he can achieve his goal well by doing that.

Finally Ghyas dreams of enlarging his shop and increasing his income up to 1000 Afghanis (US$ 20) in a day. Also he shows his appreciation to the lenders in advance and thanks them so much.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his shop

loans.name: A A Ketut Srianti

texts.id:
A.A Ketut Srianti mempunyai pekerjaan sebagai pembuat banten. Bahan – bahan yang diperlukan adalah potongan bambu yang sudah dipotong kecil-kecil serta daun kelapa, baik yang muda maupun yang tua. Keahlian yang dimilikinya sudah didapatkannya dari ibunya karena sudah menjadi tradisi bagi perempuan di Bali khususnya yang beragama Hindu .
 	Dengan modal awal Rp. 200.000.- Srianti mulai membuat berbagai  macam jenis Banten. Harga satu  ikat Banten dijual dengan harga Rp.10.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih Rp.50.000,- Jika ada pesanan dalam jumlah besar, Srianti selalu kekurangan modal. Dengan adanya bantuan modal usaha  dari Yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya, Srianti merasa sangat senang karena bisa memenuhi lebih banyak lagi pesanan terutama jika ada hari besar keagamaan. Suaminya bernama Ida Bagus Sudi Arnawa Yasa adalah seorang Tukang Ukir yang sangat terkenal didesanya. Srianti mempunyai seorang anak laki – laki, sekarang duduk dibangku kelas 2 SD. Dari hasil penjualan bantennya, Srianti selalu menyisihkan untuk ditabung agar bisa membiayai pendidikan yang lebih tinggi.
texts.en:
A.A Ketut Srianti is a Banten maker. Banten is a religious article used in Hinduism faith religious ceremony. The material of Banten is bamboo pieces and coconut leaves.

Her husband is Ida Bagus Sudi Arnawa Yasa, a well known carpenter in their village. They have one son who is now at 3rd grade at the local elementary school.

With initial capital of IDR 200 thousand (around USD 21) she can makes various styles of Banten. She can earn a profit of IDR 50 thousand (around USD 5.5). However if her customers want to place a big volume order, she cannot accept it as she doesn't have enough capital to get the material. Therefore with the loan money from DINARI foundation, she is now able to take the big orders as she can afford to buy the material. With this she can increase her revenue and she can save more money for her son's education fund.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material (Membeli bahan baku)

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Z. Mastura is 28 years old. She is married and she has two children. A friend invited her to help sell clothing at the marketplace and she jumped at the offer. This is how she learned the skills needed to manage a store in the marketplace. She decided to open her own business. She put some money together and bought women's tights, socks and kerchiefs and started her business three years ago with these items. Mastura has been able to help her husband with living expenses and to provide for her young 2 year old daughter. 
 
However, Mastura thinks it is important to buy new merchandise so she can stock a wider variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. Mastura is requesting a loan of $300 which will be paid back in installments over the course of 12 months. With this loan, Mastura will be able to buy the merchandise she needs to increase her income. Thanks to your help, she will be better able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of inventory

loans.name: Ida Ayu Komang Wartini

texts.id: Sejak menikah dengan Ida Bagus Komang Parsana, Ida Ayu Komang Wartini memulai usahaanya membuat Semat ( salah satu kelengkapan membuat sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ). Usaha ini berawal ketika dibelakang rumah Ida Ayu Komang Wartini terdapat pohon bambu yang merupakan bahan khusus untuk membuat Semat. Seiring dengan berjalannya waktu tidak terasa sudah hampir 20 tahun Ida Ayu menekuni usaha ini. Karena sudah mempunyai banyak pelanggan, Ida Ayu harus membeli bambu, karena tidak ada lagi bambu dibelakang rumahnya. Ida Ayu meminjam modal di Yayasan Dinari untuk membeli bambu dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak untuk meningkatkan usahanya karena pelanggannya sudah banyak. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari modal Rp. 300.000.- adalah Rp. 40.000.- per hari cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah anak keduanya yang duduk dibangku SMA.
texts.en:
Since married with Ida Bagus Komang Parsana, Ida Ayu Komang Wartini started her business of Semat making (Semat is one of religious articles for Hindu's rituals). The busines was starting when there was bamboo tree for Semat raw material at the back of her house. As time goes, it has been 20 years since Ida Ayu Komang run the business. As the demand increases and bamboo at the back of her house depletes, she now needs to buy bamboo. Ida Ayu loans capital from Dinari Foundation to buy bamboo in large amount to increase her business due to the increase of her customer. The profit she made from capital of USD 33 is USD 5 per day. And it is enough to cover her daily needs and high school tuition fee of her second child.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bamboo for raw material

loans.name: Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti

texts.id: Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti adalah sosok ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet. Sehabis mengantar anaknya sekolah dan menyelesaikan semua pekerjaan rumah tangganya, Ida Ayu Ketut memulai aktivitasnya membuat jajan tradisional. Aktivitas ini hampir setiap hari dilakukan mulai jam 09.00 pagi hingga jam 12.00 siang. Untuk membuat jajan tradisional ini memerlukan proses yang sangat panjang hingga bisa dijual ke konsumen. Dari proses mengolah bahan baku hingga menjemur, menghabiskan waktu satu hari. Modal yang di perlukan Rp. 500.000.- untuk membeli  ketan, gula serta bahan campuran lainnya. Kurangnya modal yang dimiliki Ida Ayu Ketut membuatnya sangat berharap mendapatkan bantuan dari  Dinari yang bekerja sama dengan organisasi didesanya. Jajan yang sudah siap jual, langsung dibawa ke pasar tempat para langganannya. Jajan ini sangat laku terjual karena hampir setiap saat dipergunakan untuk sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu di Bali.Keuntungan bersih yang diperoleh dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah kedua anaknya, karena penghasilan suaminya yang tidak menentu, tapi Ida Ayu Ketut merasa bahagia  walau  tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana,  namun terlihat asri dan mereka bahagia.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Ketut Sudiarti is a persevere housewife. After taking her children to school and finishing house chores, she starts making traditional delicacies. This is an everyday activity from 9 AM until 12 PM. It is a long process before the delicacies can reach her customers. From mixing the ingredients and sun-drying them, it takes one whole day. The capital she needs to buy ingredients suh as sticky rice, sugar and others is USD 55. Her lack of capital, makes her in need for capital loan from Dinari that cooperates with her village organization. Ready for sell delicacies are directly taken to her customers in the market. The delicacies are easy to be sold, as it is always used as an offering for Hindu's rituals in Bali. The net profit she makes is utilized to meet her daily needs and for education of her two children. Eventhough her husband does not have fix income, she is still happy. And she is happy lliving in modest yet pretty nice and neat house.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Bedaar

texts.en:
Bedaar Z. is one of those youths who wasn't able to go school and become educated. He is 22 and a resident of Ningarhar province. There are 6 members in his family; his father is about 60 and has some serious illnesses. Bedaar has three brothers. His older brother has a mobile repair shop in Jalalabad city, and two others are studying in public schools, but they all live in one home.

Presently, Bedaar is single. He started working when he was only 7 years old, because, at that time, his father was faced with some serious illnesses and his older brother couldn't provide for all the expenses of their family alone, thus Bedaar started working with a shopkeeper. 50 Afghanis (US$ 1) was his daily income. Bedaar and his brother worked hard, and they were able to support their family as well as possible, and after a few years they have saved 30,000 Afghanis (US$ 600).

Recently Bedaar opened a carpentry shop, and he thinks that this business has a good demand in the market, so he makes various furniture such as tables, beds, shelves, chairs, etc. Bedaar hopes to expand this business more and buy some new machines. But to achieve his goals easily and properly to reach his aims, he needs some money to buy new equipment. Therefore he has requested a 50,000 Afghani loan from AFSG, for a term of 18 months.

Bedaar dreams one day to open a big carpentry factory and recruit workers, also he thanks honestly the lenders who make possible this opportunity for the people.

loans.use: To buy some new machines for his shop

loans.name: Mrs. Ros Na Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which is located in Kok Kandal village in Kampong Cham province, consists of twenty-six members who will each use the loan for a different purposes.  Mrs. Ros N. is the village bank president and she is a sugar seller in the local village.  Her husband, Mr. Chea Nean, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar for his wife to sell.  Since Mrs. Ros N.'s consumers are increasing and they have a lot of demand, Mrs. Ros N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugar in order to reach her customers' demands.  

Mrs. Ros N. is 51 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while two others own a small grocery store in the local market.  The youngest one is attending school.  

Two men among the three in the photo came to take the loan instead of their wives because they are busy with their work.  Mrs. Thuoch C. is the group guarantee and has not asked for a loan, but she is also presented in the picture.  The boy who is standing at the back of the photo is one member's sibling. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These twelve members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more sugar in order to reach her customers' demands.

loans.name: Mrs. Chheum Sokha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people in Trapeang Phnov village in Kampong Cham province have formed the village bank loan and they each plan to use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Chheum S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She owns a small grocery store in the local village.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.  Her husband, Mr. Nuon Mengsrun, is a village chef who makes a small salary to support his family.  Mrs. Chheum S. is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending school.  

Two men among the three in the picture came to take the loan instead of their wives so they are presented here.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These nine members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Sreyneth Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which is located in Suong Kaeut village in Kampong Cham province, consists of nine people.  Mrs. Meas S. is the village bank president.  She is a cake seller who makes $5 for an income.  Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make cake for her customers.  Mrs. Meas S. is a 26 year old widow with two children who are both too young to work or study because they are only at the ages of two and five.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make cake for her customers.

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Sokhom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of eight members who all live in Chrey Bet Meas village in Kampong Cham province.  They each plan to use the loan for a different purpose.  For instance, Mrs. Sam S. is the village bank president and she owns a small field where she grows potatoes.  Since her plantation is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy potato seeds to grow on her field.  Mrs. Sam S. is a widow with three children, one of whom helps her in the field while another one is employed in a garment factory.  The remaining one owns a small restaurant that sells food to passengers.  Mrs. Sam S. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy potatoe seeds for cultivating her field.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod A. is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. Dilshod is an engineer by training. Currently he does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family as a businessman. He remains a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Dilshod sells fuel: petrol and diesel fuel. Over 8 years of selling fuel, he already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has customers who always come to him. Now Dilshod’s business is running very well and for that reason he wants to expand his business by opening another filling station.

With this purpose in mind, Dilshod is requesting a loan of 1000 USD. He promises to return this amount in 9 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Dilshod’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing fuel for re-sale in order to expand the business

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang H., 41, is a widower and lives with four children. Living in Kampong Cham, he is able to make around US$ 2.50 each day from construction work. He has been a construction worker since 1998. He told a loan officer that he sometimes needs to go outside of the village to find construction work.

One of his children is still a student and the others are employed at different jobs to support the family. As now he is getting older, he needs to find other jobs for himself that use little labor and make easy profit. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Kiva to breed pigs for extra profit.

loans.use: To breed pigs for extra profit

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: G. Karim is 45 years old. He is married and has two children of school age. Karim is providing taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for about 3 years. It is the main source of income for his family. Karim is working hard. He gets up early and goes to bed late trying not to lose any clients. Karim has no higher education but he dreams that both of his children will get to go to university. He is planning to send his daughter to the university next year. Karim is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher quality service so that he can earn more income. He requests $1000 for the term of 9 months. With this loan Karim is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. Let’s get behind this dedicated father to make his dream become a reality.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for taxi

loans.name: Hindie

texts.en:
Hindie is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 10 and 4 years old. She has been a tailor and clothes seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Hindie is now requesting a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 42 years old and married, with 7 children between 28 and 5 years old. She has been a snacks seller since 1995. Every day, she works from 7AM to 5PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Asma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en: K. Hidoyat is a dynamic and ambitious 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For 4 years she has had a small business processing dried fruit. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown. This allows Hidoyat to contribute significantly to the household and education of her children. Today Hidoyat requests $900 for the term of 8 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried fruits for the purpose of processing and reselling them. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy N. is 59 years old and has a business selling Khmer cake to earn a living. She is able to make around US$ 4 each day. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed as a garment factory worker.

Khmer cake whose name in our language is "A Kao" is one of the favorite cakes among Cambodian people. It's made from rice and coconut. Mrs. Huy would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son to use to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en: K. Muharram is 42 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of 4 children. Since 1998 Muharram has run her own business embroidering the national skull-cap for men and women. Muharram producies various types of the national skull-cap. She has many clients and usually there are many orders. His children help her with the business. The ready-made skull-caps that Muharram is selling are in demand. Thus, her business is stable which allows her to contribute significantly to the family budget. Today Muharram is requesting $600 for the term of 9 months. The loan is for purchasing the fabrics for embroidering. Muharram thanks you for your support and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for embroidering

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech S., 29, is a mother of one little kid and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a road worker and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband is a truck driver. On average, he makes US$5 per day. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$700 to purchase yams in bulk to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase yams in bulk to sell in the market.

loans.name: Nihifadh

texts.en:
Nihifadh A. is 26 years old and single with one six-year-old child. She has run her own shop since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Nihifadh now looking for a loan to buy more commodities to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Louch

texts.en: Louch C., 35, is a construction foreman and is able to make around US$7 each day. His wife, Long Sinoeurn, is a farm worker raising pigs for sale. On average, she makes around US$2 each day. This couple together has two children and all of them are students. Mr. Louch is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more pigs for his wife. (Long is pictured outside of her home.)

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for his wife.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam J. M. is 25 years old and married with two children. She has been selling clothes, shoes and handbags since 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Maryam now seeking for a loan to increase her clothing and shoes inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Tunda

texts.en:
Tunda A. is 45 years old. She is divorced with three children between the ages of seven and thirteen. She has been selling charcoal, firewood and handbags since 2005. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Tunda now requesting a loan to increase her current stock of charcoal and firewood so as to improve her business.

loans.use: To increase her charcoal and firewood inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of lumber and purchase equipment

loans.name: I Made Yudana

texts.id: Karena perkembangan peternakan sapi dari masing-masing warga di sekitar tempat tinggal Made Yudana sangatlah pesat membuat Made yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai saudagar sapi yang mengangkut sapi ke pasar penjualan harus memperbaharui sarana pengangkutannya supaya bisa mengangkut lebih banyak dan lebih cepat. Usaha yang ditekuni sejak lama ini memang memberi penghasilan yang lumayan untuk keluarga kecilnya bersama istri dan kedua anaknya yang masih kecil. Istrinya juga turut membantu usaha Made ini disamping juga memelihara ternak babi sebagai sampingan. Made bermaksud mengembangkan usahanya dengan menjual alat angkut sapinya yang terdahulu yaitu sebuah truk yang kecil dan sudah tua lalu kemudian menggantinya dengan yang baru dan lebih besar. Karena kekurangan modal untuk membeli alat usahanya dan Made mendengar bahwa DINARI mempunyai program yang bisa meningkatkan modal usaha masyarakat maka Made memutuskan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI lewat program KIVA dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan. Dimana pembayaran akan dilakukan setiap bulannya. Dengan meminjam sebesar Rp. 5000.000,- ke DINARI mampu menambah modalnya untuk bisa mendapatkan alat angkut berupa truk yang lebih besar dengan kondisi lebih baru. Dengan truk ini Made mampu memasarkan sapi sampai 3 kali seminggunya dengan menggunakan 2 orang tenaga kerja serta jangkauan pembelian sapinya sampai ke daerah yang lebih jauh. Penghasilan yang didapat pu makin meningkat setiap bulannya sehingga mampu memenuhi gaji tenaga kerja yang dipakai serta sekaligus bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Due to the development of cow raising/farm in his neighborhood, Made Yudana needs to renew his transportation vessel that can transport cows more and faster. His business has contribute alot for his small family consisting his wife and two young children. His wife also help him in generating income by raising pig. Made intends to develop his business by selling his old and small pickup truck and buy bigger and newer one. Due to lack of capital and hearing about Dinari that has program to increase business capital, then Made decided to borrow to Dinari through KIVA program with term if 12 months, where repayment will be done every month. He plans to borrow USD 550 from Dinari to add the capital to buy truck with bigger and better condition. With such truck Made is able to sell cows three times a weel. And by employing 2 worker he can reach further locations. His income increases every month that he can afford to pay his workers and to meet his family necessities.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add capital to buy pickup truck

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh S. is 33 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, preserved foods and many others in his grocery store.

Farrukh is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Currently Farrukh has about US$ 1000 in inventory and his monthly net profit is about US$ 300-400. Today Farrukh is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 10 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Farrukh’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful businessmen. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods sold

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi S. is 22 years and she is single. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 4:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwanaharusi now seeking a loan to increase her clothes inventory in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and single. She takes care of 2 people, aged 40 and 50. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8AM to 2PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase equipment for breaking and shaping building stones

loans.name: Faizigul

texts.ru: Сафарова Файзигуль жительница города Яван.Хочет получить кредит  для того , чтобы купить корову. Корова ей нужна для того , чтобы обеспечить семью молоком. У нее есть опыт в уходе за животными 20 лет. Файзигуль замужем и имеетчетверых детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizigul S. is a resident of Yavan. She wishes to take out a loan to buy a cow to provide her family with milk. She has twenty years of experience in caring for animals. Faizigul is married and has four children. She intends to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung S., born in 1970, is a widow who sells fruit at the local market making US$5 each day. She lives with her four children and her parents. Two of her children are still too young to attend school, and the other two work at a local garment factory to help support the family. Her parents live with her as well and raise cows, while her father also does some fishing for extra income. Ung S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$500 to purchase fishing nets and other fishing tools for her father to increase his catch and improve his business. With any leftover money she would like to purchase more cows for her parents to raise and breed. The parents' businesses are small and expansion can increase income, helping to support the whole family.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net and tools

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Холмурод проживает  в городе Яван. Занимается животноводством. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для того , чтобы купить корову. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Занимается купле продажей крупно рогатого скота уже 10 лет.
texts.en:
Holmurod B. lives in the city of Yavan and raises livestock. He is married and has five children. He wishes to take out a loan and use it to buy cows. He will repay the loan over the course of twelve months. He has been in the business of buying and selling large-horned cattle for ten years.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and food.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek P., 26, is a mother of two children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has been raising pigs at her home and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband, Chheng Sroly, has a business catching fish from the river and selling them to the market to earn an approximately around US$5 in profits per day. Chek is requesting a loan of US$1000 from Kiva to purchase a boat motor for her husband and the rest of the money is to be used to add more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for her husband and the rest of the money is used to add more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes in bulk

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 40, is a mother of two children—one is a student and the other is a garment worker—and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Chhun Rim, have a business purchasing recycled items and are able to make around US$3 each day. This couple told a loan officer that they started that business when they married, over nine years ago. To earn more money, Sok would like a loan from Kiva of US$600 to add to the number of recycled items for sale. (Sok is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: To add to the number of recycle items purchased for sale.

loans.name: Azizmo

texts.ru: Зиеева  Азизмо жительница города Яван. Работает на центральном рынке города. Привозит из Душанбе товар – ткани , затем реализует у себя на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот.  Это поможет развитию ее бизнеса.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев. Азизмо замужем и имеет  пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Azizmo Z. resides in the town of Yavan and works in the town’s central market. The goods and fabrics she brings in from Dushanbe are sold at her spot in the marketplace. She has been in this business for ten years. Azizmo plans to take out a loan to increase the turnover of inventory, which will enable her business to grown. She will be able to repay the loan within fifteen months. Azizmo is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover of inventory

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng N., 31, works selling traditional Khmer medicine in her village. People living in the province mostly believe in traditional medicine more than in than commercial drugs. On average, she makes around US$3 each day. Her husband, Srey Limheng, 37, has a business catching fish from the lake and then sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$4 per day. This couple together has six children, two of whom are students. She told to a loan officer that every month she spends around US$70 on food, US$20 on transportation and US$30 on her children's education.
She is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase a motor for her husband's wooden boat.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for her husband's wooden boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase knitting machine and thread

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.ru: Файзов Саидбек житель Явана. Работает таксистом. Имеет собственный автомобиль. Работает по маршруту Душанбе – Яван. Деятельность приносит доход. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход и уменьшить стоимость проезда Саидбек хочет установить газовое оборудование. Для этого он должен получить кредит  , срокм на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ривлечь клиентов , которым будет дешевле ездить на его машине. Кроме того он сможет сделать больше рейсов и заработать больше. Таким образом он обеспечит свою семью лучше. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Saidbek F. resides in Yavan, and is a taxi driver with his own automobile. He works the route between Dushanbe and Yavan. This business brings in income, but to increase his earning and reduce the cost of each trip Saidbek wants to install equipment to reduce gasoline consumption. To do so, he must take out a 12-month loan. This would attract clients whose ride in his taxi would be less expensive. In addition, he would be able to make more runs, earn more, and better support his family. He is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Automobile Repair

loans.name: Mrs. Deang Savet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of ten people who all live in Trapeang Krasang village in Takeo province.  Mrs. Deang S. is the village bank president.  She is farmer and poultry breeder who raises 40 chickens.  Her husband, Mr. Pho Phat, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes $4 per day.  Even though she and her husband have different businesses, they sill cannot support their family well, so Mrs. Deang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a new business.  Mrs. Deang S. is 32 years old and the mother of two children who are both enrolled in the local school. 

Two members in this village bank have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These two members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a new business.

loans.name: Rizki's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Riziki H. M. is married with a two-year-old child. She has been selling clothes since early 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Riziki now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with Mgeni K. J., who also has a shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Джалолова Сафаргуль жительница города Нурек.Возраст 38 лет, вдова , имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Сафаргуль  занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке города Нурек.Занимается  бизнесом более 5 лет. Так как муж у нее умер, ей приходится самой содержать свою семью.Бизнес является единственным  источником дохода ее большой семьи.На полученный кредит клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safargul J. resides in the town of Nurek. 38-years-old, she is a widow with four children. She attended secondary school, and now trades in women’s clothing at a small stall in the local Nurek town market. She has been in this business for more than five years. Since the death of her husband, the support of her family has fallen to her, and the business is her large family’s sole source of income. With this loan Safargul wishes to increase the variety of goods for sale at her stall. She plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Mrs. En Theng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. En T. is a group leader of four who all live in Peak Bang'aong village in Takeo province.  Each will use the loan for a different purpose.  For instance, Mrs. En T. is a farmer who is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers in order to produce a better crop while she faces infertile soil on her field.  Her husband, Mr. Seng Vuth, is laborer who makes $3 per day.  Mrs. En T. is 44 years old and she does not have any children.  She hopes to make a better crop with this loan. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to produce a better crop while she faces infertile soil on her field.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Mwanahamisi S., a widow with eight children. She started a business of selling cereals such as maize, millet, sorghum, etc., which are all widely available in Tanzania because the economy is 70% agricultural and these cereals comprise a primary portion of the local diet. She now focuses on selling maize because it is the most marketable, being used to make ugaali, a staple food in this country. She earns about 180 USD in profit monthly from this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase maize in bulk. In the future, she hopes to increase the scale of her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Mwatum's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mwatum B. is 30 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 14. She has been a food vendor since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwatum now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to improve her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who also have businesses dealing with shop ownership, home utensils sales, tailoring, firewood and charcoal sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items to improve her business.

loans.name: Bibijon

texts.ru: Зиеева Бибиджон жительница города Нурек.Возраст 46 лет, разведенна, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей детской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на рынке города Нурек. На доход от торговли она содержит свою семью.На полученный кредит Бибиджон хочет закупить сезонный товар.Планирует погасить  кредит в течении 10 месяецв.
texts.en:
Bibijon Z. resides in the city of Nurek. 46-years-old, she is divorced and the mother of five children. She has a secondary school education, and trades in children’s clothing from her small stall at the Nurek town market. With the income from this business, she supports her family. Bibijon wishes to purchase seasonal goods with this loan, and plans to repay it within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima T. A. is 26 years old and married with a one-year-old child. She has been a teacher and clothes seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Naima hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Mr. Nop Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of thirteen members, is located in Ba Khong Khang Lech Village within Takeo Village. Mr. Nop H. is the village bank president, having been selected by the membership. He is 42-years-old and the father of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend school.

Mr. Nop H. is a Prohok seller in the local market. Prohok is made by using small fish as an ingredient for soup. Roast Beef with Prohok is an exceptionally delicious menu in Cambodia. His business is going well, but Mr. Nop H. wants to expand so he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more Prohok to increase his sales. His wife, Mrs. Sok TH., helps him in the current business.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase more Prohok to increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Калугшоева Гулрухсор жительница района Яван.Возраст 36 лет,замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Гулрухсор свыше 5 лет занимается развдением крупно-рогатого скота. Но в данный момент у нее в доме нет дойной коровы .Покупать на рынке кисло-молочную продукцию дорого.Поэтому клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor K. is a resident of the Yovon region. 36-years-old, she is married and has one child. For more than five years Gulruhsor has reared large-horned cattle; however, at present she has no dairy cows in her herd. Since buying milk products at the market is expensive, she has decided to take out a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Appia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Appia M. is a 28-year-old single woman with no children. She has been running a stationery business since 2005 and earns about 400 USD in profit each month. Appia is hoping to expand her business further to attract a wider customers base and is requesting a loan in order to purchase a binding machine, a laminating machine, and rent a larger store to accommodate her growing business needs!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for a stationery business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Караев Хасан житель района Яван.Возраст 34 года, женат, имеет 3 детей.Образвоание среднее.Клиент более 5 лет занимается  разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Он покупает на рынке молодых бычков ,откармливает их и сдает на мясо в мясные ларьки. Этот вид бизнеса позволяет ему прокормитьт свою семью.В данный  момент клиент хочет купить 2 бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hasan K. is a resident of the Yovon region. 34-years-old, he is married and has three children. He attended secondary school, and has raised large-horned cattle for more than five years. He purchases young steers, fattens them and sells the meat to butchers. This type of business permits him to feed his family. At present he would like to purchase two steers. He plans to repay the loan over the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two steers

loans.name: Mr. Kaoh Khlaing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who live in the Kaoh Nhae Village in Takeo Province have created a village bank loan and selected Mr. Kaoh K., 58, as the village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. Khoem Nuon, are farmers and have one child who attends school. The couple now face a small problem because their field has infertile soil. Mr. Kaoh K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil of his field to bear improved crops.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to supplement the soil and produce better crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stone quarry equipment

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Алихонов Давлатали проживает в городе Яван. Работает главным бухгалтером на предприятии ООО»Гаюр». Кроме того зарабатывает деньги путем занятием животводством. Имеет хозяйство где разводит КРС. Поэтому планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить комбикорм и сено. Это поможет ему своевременно откармливать животных и продавать хороших , откормленных бычков. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davlatali A. lives in the city of Yavan. He works as the head accountant for the firm Gayur Ltd., but supplements his income by rearing livestock. Davlatali has a farm where he raises large-horned cattle, and plans to take out a loan to purchase feed and hay. This will aid him in both feeding his animals and selling well-fattened steers. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S., 33, is a bean farmer and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land growing beans since 2007 and makes less than one dollar per day. Planting beans has been difficult, since she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer and the weather is unreliable, too. Her husband, Yun Dorn, 40, is a truck driver and he normally makes US$3.30 per day. This couple has no children. She told to a loan officer that every month she spends around US$30 on food, US$15 on transportation and US$10 on other expenses. In her village, people depend on batteries to power their lighting, TV, and radios.

Mrs. Kuy is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a horse and cart to transport goods for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase horse and cart to transport goods for extra profit.

loans.name: Faida's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Faida is 25 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 6 and 2 years old. She has been a cosmetics seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $72 from her sales.

Faida is now looking for a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with porridge sales, khanga (traditional Tanzanian cloth) and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to improve her business

loans.name: Zainab's Tawakal Group

texts.en:
