Zainab S. is 33 years old and married with five children aged 15, 12, 7, 4 and 2. She has been a broken down stone and water seller since 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zainab is now looking for a loan to buy inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who also have businesses dealing with soup sales, fruit sales, clothes sales and tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Hafizillo

texts.ru: Исматов Хафизилло житель города Яван. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков. Основная сфера деятельности их местности это животноводство. Уже 11 лет разводит крупно рогатый скот. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить породистого бычка. Постепенно он сможет давать качественное потомство. Это даст толчок к развитию данного сектора. Кроме того , сможет обеспечить рынок качественным мясом и молочными продуктами. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hafizillo I. resides in the town of Yavan, one of the most remote villages. He is married and has four children. Livestock is the main business in that locale, and Hafizillo has raised large-horned cattle for the past 11 years. He wishes to take out a loan to purchase a purebred bull that will gradually beget high-quality calves, providing a stimulus to development of the livestock sector. Additionally, Hafizillo will be able to supply the market with high-quality meat and milk products. He intends to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Violeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Violeth M.. She is a married woman with two children, ages two and three. She owns a business selling traditional African cloth, which she has been running since 2005. Local Tanzanian women buy her cloth and use it to tailor fashionable outfits. She currently earns about 250 USD in monthly profit from this business and now is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of cloth. Violeth is assisted by one employee in running her cloth stall and plans to increase the quantity and range of stock she sells in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional African cloth in bulk

loans.name: Mahmatqul

texts.ru: Ятимов Махматкул фермер со стажем. Уже 18 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает молодых бычков для продажи на мясо. Кроме того имеет корову , которая дает молоко. Молоко использует для производства кисло-молочных продуктов. Продукцию реализует оптом на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка. Это увеличит товарооборот и принесет доход для семьи и развития бизнеса. Махматкул женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Она помогают ему ухаживать за животными. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmatqul Y. is an experienced farmer, who has raised cattle for 18 years. He fattens young steers to sell for meat. In addition he has a cow that provides milk used for the production of cultured milk products to be sold wholesale. Mahmatqul wishes to take out a loan for the purchase of an additional bull. This will increase his turnover, expanding his business and providing income for his family. Mahmatqul is married and has eight children. His wife assists him in caring for the animals. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin C., 41, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Since she is self-employed as a rice farmer, her farm supports the family from day to day. She makes no profit. Two of her children are garment workers and one other is a farmer like her. To double the family's income, she needs a loan of US$650 to set up a new business selling groceries.

loans.use: To set up a new business selling groceries.

loans.name: Zainab's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Zainab J. A. is 40 years and married with four children, aged 22, 20, 16 and 12. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 6:30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Zainab now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to improve her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling firewood, coconuts, perfumes and khanga.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Muong Sovannary Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong S. is the group loan leader with four members, all of whom live in Trapeang Srang Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Muong S. is 20-years-old and has just married so she does not have any children.

She is pig breeder in the local village. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Muong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sitha, is a garment factory worker and his income helps to support his family. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan after selling her pigs.

loans.use: To buy purchase additional piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S., 47, is married and lives with five of her seven children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer but her farm is just to support the family members from day to day . Her husband has been a bean farmer since he married with his wife. On average, he typically makes US$1.70 in profits per day. Two children are students and three others are garment factory workers. She told a loan officer that she on average spends on food US$40 every month, US$10 on children's education, US$15 on transportation. To double the family's income she has requested a loan of US$500 to purchase a horse and cart to transport goods for profit.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart to transport goods for profit.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin Y., 39, works making rice noodles to sell in the village, earning approximately US$2.3 in profits each day. Rice noodle is one of the old Khmer foods and people mostly have it with soup, either red or blue soup. The blue soup is cooked from fish only but red can be pork or chicken. She and her husband and one of her sons are pictured close to a grinding tool in the process of making rice noodles.

Her husband, Sam Chuk, 38, is a rice farmer and palm climber. He makes around US$1.6 per day. He told to a loan officer that his farm is just to have enough to eat from day to day and mostly the profit is from the sugar palm business. Everyday he collects palm juice and then boils it into palm sugar and sells it in the market.

Mrs. Bin is asking a loan of US$500 to invest in her business by adding to the number of rice noodles she makes, and the rest of the money is to be used to purchase fertilizers for her husband's farm.

loans.use: To add the number of making rice noodle and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Fatma's Tawakal Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 30 years old. She is a widow with 4 children aged 12, 8, 5, and 3 years old. She's owned a small food store since 2005. Every day, she works at her business.

Fatma is now looking for a loan to buy more food items to increase her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with banana sales, juice and charcoal sales, shop ownership and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her current stock

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi A. M. is 49 years old and married with two children, aged 19 and 22. She has owned and run a small shop for home products since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm.

Mkasi now seeking a loan to buy more inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem T., 33, is a widow and lives with her parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She works growing rice and beans and she is able to make US$6 per day. She is a widow and has no children. Currently, she has requested a loan of US$800 to rent a banana farm to grow fruit. She told a loan officer that she has been growing rice since she was young and planting beans over five years so far. Renting a banana farm for fruit is the first business, so she hopes to gain more profits to help support her standard of living.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm to grow fruit.

loans.name: Zuhura's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura J. is 21 years old and divorced with a 6-year-old child. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Zuhura now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling firewood, coconuts and fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en:
Kidawa is 39 years old, is married, and has 5 children between the ages of 12 and 5. She has sold charcoal, firewood and coconuts since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business.

In the past, Kidawa has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kidawa is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: De nationalité béninoise dame S. Pauline est née le 05 Avril 1971 à Cotonou au Sud du BENIN. Divorcé d'avec son mari il y a deux (02) ans, elle a à sa charge trois enfants dont Salomon le benjamin est âgé de 3 ans. Pour subvenir aux charges qui lui incombent désormais en tant que mère de famille, elle s'est lancé dans la distribution des chaussures, du lait, du savons et bien d'autres articles. Les soirs, elle expose ses articles dans un coin de rue non loin de son domicile. N'ayant plus assez de ressources financières pour s'approvisionner, elle vient solliciter ce crédit pour répondre favorablement aux attentes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline S. was born on April 5th, 1971 in Cotonou, located in the south of Benin. Mrs. S. and her husband divorced two years ago and she supports her three children. The youngest child, Salomon, is three years old. To meet the needs of her family she began selling shoes, milk, soap and other products. In the evenings, she displays her products on a street corner not far from her home. As she no longer has the financial resources to stock her supplies, she has requested this loan so that she can continue to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of 6 boxes of soap, 120 pairs of shoes, 1 box of milk and 1 box of batteries

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon S. Un, 27, is married and lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling banana blossoms to earn a living and is able to make US$1.5 of profit each day. Her husband is a farm security guard in the village and on average he makes US$2 per day. Two of their children are students and the rest are too young to attend the school. She told the loan officer that she spends around US$40 on food, US$2 on utilities, US$10 on the children's education and another US$10 on transportation.

To earn more profits, she needs to loan from Kiva of US$400 to rent a banana farm to bear fruit.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm to bear fruit.

loans.name: Daung

texts.en:
Daung Y., 39, is a farmer, making less than one dollar per day in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has four children, two of whom are students and one of whom is employed. Her husband, Much Soeun, makes approximately US$ 1.60 every day, working as carpenter.

Daung would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, of US$ 150 to purchase seeds (cucumber and other crops) to grow. She told a loan officer that her husband started doing carpentry over five years ago. That business her husband knows from his father. She herself has worked growing rice since before she was married and just now she has started planting crops for extra profit.

Daung Y. continues that farmers make little profit but use a lot of labor. There are no irrigation systems in almost every province and the weather has been difficult for every farmer, too. In the future, she wants to build a better house and she wants her children to study until they get a Bachelor's Degree if possible.

loans.use: To purchase seeds (cucumber and other crops) to grow

loans.name: Yabo

texts.fr: Née vers 1975 dans un village de Porto Novo, dame O. Yabo a épousé à monsieur ODJO Pierre. Elle est mère de 02 enfants, Annick et Gwladys, tous à sa charge et scolarisés. Elle vend des tomates en boîtes  qu'elle achète du Nigeria et qu'elle livre immédiatement au marché à ses clientes qui l'attendent déjà. A cause de la cherté de la vie que nous traversons actuellement et de la flambée des prix, elle s'est rapprochée de notre institution pour obtenir un prêt afin de mieux se positionner sur le marché.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in a village in Porto Novo, Mrs. Yabo O. is married to Mr. Pierre Odjo. She is the mother of two children, Annick and Gwladys, and she is responsible for both the children who are still in school. She sells tinned tomatoes that she buys in Nigeria and delivers immediately to the market to her customers who are already waiting. Because of the rising cost of living that we are undergoing at present and the price hikes, she came to our institution to obtain a loan so as to better position herself in the marketplace.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 cases of canned goods (tomatoes)

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima A. is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 8 and 16. She sells small fish and spices. Naima works at her business every day and earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Naima has successfully used a previous loan, also from BRAC Tanzania, to expand her business. She is now requesting a second loan to buy more fish and spices for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and spices inventory for her business.

loans.name: Sharifa's Tusongembele. Group

texts.en:
Sharifa A. is 48 years old and married with one 15-year-old child. She is a charcoal and firewood seller. She works at this daily and earns a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Sharifa is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling clothes, bites, firewood, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai N., 61, is married with three children and lives in Khan Meanchey, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband not only work as landlords, but they also work selling breakfast and lunch to their tenants and the people in their area, making typically around $15/day of income. Meanwhile, one of her children is a construction worker, one works selling sugar cane juice and the rest work helping her parents.
Mrs. Thai N. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a stand at a market, the best location to serve her food.

loans.use: To purchase a stand at a market to sell her food

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 44 years old and has four children, two of whom are working adults. In 2003, she joined TYM and borrowed funds to buy materials for her mat-making business, a traditional job in her area. With her experience and professional skill, all of the products she makes sell well, so her family's income increases regularly. 

In addition to this business, her family farms and raises animals. With an income of about $180 per month and some financial assistance from her two grown children, her family's living quality has improved significantly.  

Nguyen is now requesting a loan of $500 to buy rushes to weave more mats.

loans.use: To buy rushes to weave mats.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Horm K. is 50 years old and has a business selling vegetables in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works collecting the crops from a small farm, and then sells them at the market to earn an approximately US$5.30 each day. Her husband works as a farmer and makes less than one dollar per day. Actually, he farms just enough for the family members but cannot make a profit. Farming is hard, and sometimes if there is no rain he will face crop damage. This couple has four children, two of whom are students and two others who are employed as garment workers. Horm would like to borrow US$700 from Kiva to rent the banana farm to raise fruit to sell. She has no plan for a future business, but she said she will try hard for her children to get a higher education in order to get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm to raise fruit to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q. is 51 years old. She has been with TYM since 2003. Her family lives in an area with mat weaving as a traditional job so besides farming and animal raising, they spend most of their remaining time on their mat-weaving business. As she is skilled and experienced in this business, her products sell well and bring about an increase in their income. With their income of VND 3 million plus financial assistance from her child, who has a stable job, her family's economy is getting stable and developing. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 8 million to buy rushes for her mat-weaving business.

loans.use: to buy rushes for her mat-weaving business

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née le 28 décembre1963, dame H. K. Justine est originaire de EKPE dans le département de l'Ouémé et mère de 03 enfants que sont Jacques âgé de 16 ans; Paul âgé de 13 ans et de Lucrèce âgée de 06 ans respectivement en classe de Seconde au cours secondaire ; cinquième au cours secondaire et CP au cours primaire. Elle vend au détail du lait, des biscuits, des bombons et des fournitures scolaires. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle expose tous ses articles. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en fournitures scolaires à la veille de la rentrée des classes.
texts.en:
Mrs Justin H. K. was born on December 28, 1963, and came originally from Ekpe in the region of Oueme. She is the mother of three (3) children; Jacques age 16 who is in fifth grade in Secondary school, Paul, age 13 in second grade in Secondary school and Lucrece, age 6 in Primary school. She sells items including milk, biscuits candies and school supplies. She maintains a stall where she exhibits all of these articles. She has come to request this loan to satisfy her customers needs for school supplies as the return to school approaches soon.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phung T. T., 25 years old, joined TYM  2 years ago. Before, her family mainly grew rice and sold mats. Then they realized that junk selling would be more profitable, so they switched to this business. After 8 years dealing with this business, they are very experienced now and junk selling has become their main source of income. With VND 150,000 earned from this job, her family's living conditions have been improved. Now she wants to borrow VND 9 million to further invest in this business.

loans.use: to expand their junk sales

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Tran Thi H. joined TYM Fund in 2006. Before this turning point, she encountered many financial difficulties as she had a lot of children but lacked capital to do business other than basic farming and livestock raising. After borrowing from TYM, her family had capital to buy materials for mat weaving. Thanks to the loan, she had more mats to sell and her family's income increased steadily. With an income of VND 3 million per month, her family's economy is better now and more stable. She wants to borrow VND 7 million to buy more materials to weave mats.

loans.use: Tran would like to buy more materials to weave mats to sell.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: Dame K. Firmine est âgée de 40 ans et est originaire de Abomey, la ville historique du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants tous à sa charge . Elle achète des tissus du Nigeria un pays voisin qu'elle revient vendre dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Elle confie très souvent la boutique à l'une de ses domestiques et se convertie en ambulante pour la distribution efficace de ses tissus. Pour s'acheter de nouvelles gammes de tissus et couvrir les doléances de sa clientèle, elle a fait recours au prêt à travers ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs Firmine K. is 40 years old and came originally from Aborney, an historical city in Benin. She is married and is the mother of three (3) children that she is supporting. She buys fabrics in the neighboring country of Nigeria which she brings back and sells in her store in Cotonou. She often leaves the store in the hands of one of her employees while she sells door-to-door to achieve a wider distribution of her fabrics. She is requesting this loan through ALIDE to purchase the latest line of fabrics to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bales of cotton fabric

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мухабат жительница района Восъе.Возраст 34 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование средние. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей золотых изделий.Она торгует на местном рынке района. Торговля является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как заработная плата мужа небольшая. Мухабат скупает у оптовых поставщиков золотые изделия и реализует в розницу. На кредит хочет закупить золотые украшения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabat A. resides in the Vose region. 34-years-old, she is married, has four children, and a secondary school education. She trades in items made of gold at the local regional market. This business is the main source of income for her large family as her husband’s salary is low. Muhabat buys from wholesale suppliers of jewelry and sells retail. She wants to buy gold adornments with this loan, and plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Née le 04 mars 1982, dame A. Florence est célibataire et vit actuellement avec ses parents. Elle vend des produits de consommation courante tels que lait concentré, lait en poudre, biscuits , bonbons, savons et autres qu'elle achète au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle distribue ses produits dans une boutique devant la maison de ses parents. Pour diversifier ses activités et pour augmenter son stock elle a fait recours au prêt.
texts.en:
Florence A. was born on March 04, 1982. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells basic consumer products such as concentrated milk, powered milk, biscuits, candies, soaps and other items that she buys from the Dantokpa market in Cotonou. She sells these products from a stall located in the front of her parents house. Florence requires this loan to increase her stock and diversify her business activities.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of concentrated milk, 120 boxes of powered milk, and candies

loans.name: Safia's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Safia is 34 years old and married with an 18-year-old child. She has run her own restaurant since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Safia now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling clothes, juice and bites.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Караев Рузибой  житель района Яван. Возраст  71 год, женат , имеет 4 детей. Клиент  более 25 лет занимается куплей продажей  сельхоз.животных.Так же  Несмотря на свой возраст Рузибой  разводит крупный рогатый скот. Он покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их  и перепродает на рынке по более выгодной ему цене.Этот бизнес помогает  ему  содержать свою семью.Так же у него дома постоянно имеется молоко и кисло-молочная продукция.Которая так необходима его внукам.Рузибой планирует на полученный кредит  купить очередного бычка.Погасит кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Ruziboy K. is a resident of the Yavan region. 71-years-old, he is married and has four children. For more than 25 years he has engaged in the buying and selling of farm animals. Despite his age, Ruziboy raises large-horned cattle. He buys young steers, fattens them, and resells them at the market for a profit. This business helps him to support his family, and provides his home with the fresh and cultured milk products so necessary for his grandchildren. Raziboy plans to purchase his next steer with the loan. He will repay the loan over the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Иброимов Абдумаджид житель района Куляб.Возраст  42 года, женат, имеет 6 детей.Образование средне-техническое,по специальности маляр.Заработная плата маленькая поэтому клиент занимается животноводством. На доход от бизнеса он содержит свою большую семью.В семье работает только он один. В данный момент планирует купить очередного бычка.Погасит кредит в течении 12  месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumajid I. is a resident of Kulob. 42-years-old, he is married and has six children. He attended a vocation-technical secondary school and became a house painter, but to earn extra money, he raises livestock. As the sole wage-earner in his family, he supports his large family with the income from this business. At present, Abdumajid is planning to buy his next steer. He will repay the loan over the course of twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Нурматова Зульфия жительница района Восъе.Возраст  35 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Зульфия н центральном рынке района имеет небольшую торговую точку.Торгует клиентка  бытовой химией.Жителям района не нужно ездить в город за стиральными порошками, мылом и т.д.Они знают ,что все это она могут купить не далеко от своего дома.Клиентка содержит своих детей сама одна. Поэтому хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Чем будет у нее больше качественного товара,тем больше получить доход.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya N. resides in the Vose region. 35-years-old, she is a widow with four children. Zulfiya has a small trade outlet at the regional central market, where she deals in household cleaners. Her neighbors do not need to go to town for laundry powder, soap, etc. They know that they can buy all that not far from home. As the sole source of support for her children, Zulfiya wants to increase the variety of goods she has to offer. The higher the quality of the goods she has, the greater the income. She plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru: Солихова Оимхол жительница города Нурек.Возраст 36 лет, разведенна, имеет 2 детей. Клиентка торгует на центральном рынке города Нурек.Она имеет небольшую торговуюТоргует в основном детской одеждой.Привозит товар с города Душанбе.Оимхол одна растит своих детей. Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный моменнт клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду.Поэтому решила взять кредит свроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Oimhol S. resides in the town of Nurek. 36-years-old, she is divorced and has two children. She has a small stall at the Nurek central town market where she deals primarily in children’s clothing, which she brings from the city of Dushanbe. Oimhol is raising her children alone, and the business is the sole source of income for her family. At present, Oimhol would like to purchase seasonal clothing, so she has decided to take out a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Сайидгулова Нозигуль жительница района Яван.Возраст  2 года, замужем ,имеет 3 детей. Клиентка имеет продуктовый магазин.Более 4 лет занимается бизнесом.Торговля является основным источником дохода ее семьи.Кредит берет для  пополнения ассортимента магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nozigul S. resides in Yavan district. She is married and has three children. She has a grocery store, and has been in business for more than four years. This trade is the main source of income for her family. Nozigul would like to take out a loan to replenish her store’s inventory. She plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish her inventory

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat T., 49, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Saum, 53, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1985 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married; two of them live outside the family home. One daughter is a garment factory worker and two other sons study in a local school.

Sambat has been selling meals since 1991. She herself cooks food to sell in front of a garment factory. Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years. Sambat needs a motorbike and a cart to carry meals to sell to garment factory workers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle and a cart for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a cart for her business

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun C. (shown with her fishing lot), 40, and her husband, Mr. Sokhan Oeun, 41, live along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1990 and have one son, who is a high school student.

Mrs. Soeun and her husband have been growing rice since 1980 and started fishing in 1995. Sokhan fishes in the lake behind the village and sells the fish to villagers.  Besides fishing and farming, the couple has been raising fish for two years. Soeun raises fish in her fishing lot in the Tonle Sab River.  Now the couple needs money to buy baby fish and feed for their fish-raising business. Therefore, Soeun is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase feed and baby fish to raise.

loans.use: To purchase feed and baby fish to raise.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy S., 43, and her husband, Mr. Pho Pheng, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1988 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One daughter is a silk weaver, and the other two daughters study at the local school.

Mrs. Navy has been a silk weaver since 1988, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows and does construction work. Navy is in the process of setting up a new loom for her daughter to weave silk, but she lacks the money.

Therefore, Navy is requesting a loan of $200 to set up a new loom for her daughter to start a weaving business.

loans.use: To set up a new loom for her daughter to use for weaving.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey N., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sat Saum, 40, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One daughter is married and lives outside the family home. The other daughter is a garment factory worker, and the two sons study at the local school.

Mrs. Srey has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming and working in construction for six years. Srey needs a new loom because the old one is broken.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a new loom and thread to continue her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase a new loom and thread for weaving.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K., 51, and her husband, Mr. Koet Choun, 53, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two sons and a daughter are married and live outside the family home; the daughter and her husband are both silk weavers. The unmarried son raises cows at home, and the unmarried daughter works in a garment factory.

Mrs. Pov has been farming and growing rice since she was married and has been a silk weaver for three years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married.

Pov is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy H. (shown in the picture with her husband on the right) was selected by the group to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group lives along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soy H., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sun Soeun, 42, were married in 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of the children study at the local school; the other child is employed full-time. Soy and her husband have been fishing for eight years and selling the fish at the village market. Sun does construction work as well. Soy is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase fishing nets.

Mr. Seng H., 30, (shown in the picture with his wife on the left) and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Chea, 25, were married in 1998 and have one son and one daughter. Seng has been a fisherman for ten years and his wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Seng is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Seamseng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seamseng C., 48, and her husband, Mr. Ngoun-ee Kry, 46, live in a small village across the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1980 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their children are married; one of them lives outside the family home and one is a silk weaver living in the family home. The other two children study at the local school.

Mrs. Seamseng has been a silk weaver since 2002, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice and vegetables since 1980 and has been a chef for six years as well.

Seamseng is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne N., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-ol Soy, 29, live in a small village off National Road Two about eighteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2004 and have two children, who attend the local school.

Mr. Ne has been a Remoque taxi driver for two years. A Remoque is a motorbike with a trailer on the back. He carries people and goods along National Road Two. Mrs. Sam-ol has been a garment factory worker for eleven years. Currently the couple is in the process of rebuilding their house and they lack the money to finish it. Therefore, Ne is requesting a loan of US $500 to add to his own money to rebuild his house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Marie-Anne

texts.fr: Dame A. Marie-Anne est née le 04 avril 1955 à Dassa Zounmè. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont à sa charge. Installée à Akpakpa depuis une dizaine d'année, elle s'est très tôt prise en charge à travers une activité génératrice de revenus. Elle achète des pâtes alimentaires  au Nigeria un pays voisin au Bénin, qu'elle vient revendre aux grossistes du marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle a gagné au fil des années la confiance de beaucoup de clients qui ne s'approvisionnent que chez elle. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour dynamiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie-Anne A. was born on April 4th, 1955 in Dassa Zounmè. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom she still supports. Living in Akpakpa now for approximately ten years, she took on the responsibility of earning money very early. She purchases pasta in Nigeria, a country bordering Bénin, which she then resells to distributors in the Dantokpa-Cotonou market. Over the years she has earned the trust of many clients who will not get their supplies from anyone but her. She has requested this loan to revitalize her business.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of 70 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Joyce K. is 38 years old, married with three children between the ages of 8 and 17. She is a successful entrepreneur who owns two business, namely a beauty salon and a poultry business. She started these businesses in 2006 and currently earns monthly profits of US$ 500 from them. She is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase additional hair products such as weaves (hair extensions) for her beauty salon and to purchase additional chicks and feed for her poultry business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed for her poultry business and hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Diana L.. She is a 25-year-old married woman with a five-year-old child. Diana also supports two other dependents who live with her because they are orphans and attend school in her neighborhood. She established a business selling cosmetics to local ladies in 2005 and currently earns a monthly profit of approximately US$ 120 from her store. Diana is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics in bulk. In the future she plans to expand her business further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es salaam Tanzania! This is Mwazani M., who is 25 years old. She is married with a four-year-old daughter. Earlier this year, Mwazani and her husband established a grocery business that they stocked with the help of her first loan from Kiva. She works about 12 hours a day, 6 days of the week at her business. Having successfully repaid her first loan, Mwazani is now requesting a loan of US$450 to purchase additional stocks of sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, etc, to offer a wider range of products to her customers. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods even further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase bulk inventory.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es salaam Tanzania! Janeth K. is a married woman with two children who are 6 and 9 years old. Since 2006, Janeth has been selling milk from her cows daily to locals in her neighborhood. This has enabled her to earn monthly profits of approximately $200. She is now requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase another cow to allow her to increase the amount of milk she sells daily and therefore increase her profits. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a second business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Hadija K., she is 33 years old. Hadija is a divorced woman with three children. She has been running a poultry business since 2007. This means that Hadija rears chicks and sells either the hens (once the chicks have grown) or eggs that they produce. This has helped Hadija earn a nice profit of $250 per month. She is now requesting a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional chicks and feed in bulk. In the future, she would like to open a second business to enable her to increase her profits further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed in bulk.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Zawadi K. is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been selling traditional African cloth since 2007. Women purchase cloth from her and use it to fashion wonderful outfits. Her husband assists her in running this business and together they earn monthly profits of US$100. Now Zawadi is requesting a loan of US$275 with which she is planning to purchase additional cloth in bulk. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina sells groceries in the local marketplace of Zhidachev where she lives with her family of four. She started working in the market as a salesperson. However, later she saw the benefits of being self-employed and decided to launch her own enterprise. Galina has been in this sphere of trade for five years. Currently, she has about $3000 in stock.

Galina is hoping to use the current loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1050) to increase the assortment of her merchandise and boost her sales. Galina has gained much experience working in the sphere of commerce as a salesperson at first. Today she is happy to be self-employed and see her small enterprise grow and become more and more stable. Galina is hoping to use a portion of the proceeds she generates from higher sales to pay her son's college fees.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
A small entrepreneur from Nikopol, Valentina sells groceries in one of the community markets. She is married with two kids. Valentina started her business two years ago when her children started growing up and had many more needs. She launched her start-up and got straight to work making wholesale purchases and working long hours to sell the stock. Due to her determination she now has about $3000 in turnover capital. Over $4000 is invested in inventory.

Valentina's business can be characterized as growing and stable. Her rich experience working in this sphere has added a lot to this positive standing. We believe Valentina's decisiveness and ultimate focus on success will motivate her to repay the current loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,050) on time. The loan will be very beneficial for further expansion she has planned to implement, including opening a new vending stand.

loans.use: To open a new vending stand.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a market entrepreneur from Nikopol where she lives with her husband and two daughters. Natalya has been in the grocery business for three years. Currently, she has about $2000 invested in inventory. Net profit is about $200 a month.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to increase turnover capital and generate additional profit as a result. She is hoping to see her venture growing and is planning to buy at least one more vending facility in the market. Nataliya is very good with finances. She knows how to manage money and make right investments. We believe the current loan will allow her to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a skilled seamstress. She lives and works in Nikopol manufacturing clothing and offering repair and tailoring services. She is married and her husband is very supportive of Valentina's business endeavors which are her greatest hobby as well. All her products are very well sewn and cost relatively affordable which is why Valentina always has good demand.

Currently, Valentina has about $1500 in inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to $200. She has been in this business for two years and learned some valuable lessons overcoming challenges and hard times. Valentina's business has another big advantage as it provides jobs to other people, helping fight unemployment rates which have always been a problem in Ukraine. This time Valentina is seeking a 5000 Grivna ($US1,050) loan to purchase sewing machines and accessories to improve the quality of items she offers for sale and to facilitate some working procedures for her employees.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and accessories.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Queen K., who is 40 years old and married with four children. She started a local café last year from which she prepares and sells delicious and inexpensive meals to local Tanzanians. She employs three people to help her run her café and currently earns monthly profits of about US$130. Queen is requesting a loan of US$875 to purchase bulk quantities of rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She is also planning to use part of her loan to renovate the stall from which she runs her café business. In the future, she would like to expand her café to be able to serve more customers. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bulk cooking supplies and renovations

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou D., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Kambeng Doumassou depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des balles de friperie à Dakar pour revendre au niveau des marchés de la région. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Safiétou D., is married and has been a member of the village bank of Kambeng Doumassou for 8 and a half years. She wants to buy bales of used clothes in Dakar to re-sell in the marketplaces in her area. The income from her business allows her to contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of used clothing

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou Dramé, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Kambeng Doumassou depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et vendre aussi des rafraîchissements (glaces, crèmes glaces et jus) qu'elle prépare elle même. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatou Dramé is married and has been a member of the village bank of Kambeng Doumassou for 7 years. She would like to purchase and resell dyed cloth and also sell refreshments (ice, ice cream and juice) that she prepares herself. The income from this business will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of dyed cloth and refreshments

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija de 4 años, Nancy junto a su esposo tienen un taller de reparaciones eléctricas para carros, su local es alquilado que esta ubicado en una avenida principal, su negocio lo iniciaron hace 1 año, producto de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, su esposo anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante en un taller y poco a poco fueron implementando su taller. Actualmente Nancy aprovechando la demanda de repuestos, también vende algunos repuestos básicos, productos que compra de proveedores de la misma ciudad.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos variados. Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia, educar a su hija y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. Nancy is 24 years old, lives with her partner and a 4 years old daughter. Nancy and her partner have an electric repair auto shop. They rent the place which is located in the main avenue. They started their business a year ago with a lot of effort and savings. Her husband previously worked as a helper at a shop and little by little they were able to build their own shop. Presently, there is a demand for spare parts, opportunity that Nancy is using to sell basic spare parts which she buys from suppliers in town.

Nancy needs a 100 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that will be invested in buying a variety of spare parts. Nancy's dreams are: to improve her business, own a house, provide an education for her daughter and move ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nancy needs a 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that will be invested in buying a variety of spare parts.

loans.name: Nieves Dina

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Nieves es viuda, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos de los cuales una de sus hijas estudia en la ciudad de Lima, Nieves tiene un pequeño recreo en su casa, los días lunes a viernes vende menús y platos extras y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde con la ayuda de empleadas y de su hijo, también vende bebidas variadas. Además Nieves tiene un salón grande que alquila para diferentes eventos y fiestas, Nieves en algunas oportunidades brinda el servicio de preparación de comida.

Nieves necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, cerveza, azúcar y aceite. Nieves sueña con ampliar su local, implementar y brindar más servicios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. She is 55 years old, a widow with 3 children;one of her daughters studies in the capital city of Lima. Nieves has a small food shop at home. Mondays through Fridays she sells menu items and extra dishes and on Saturdays and Sundays, she sells traditional food, an activity that she starts from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. with the help of some employees and her son. She also sells a variety of beverages as well. Nieves also has a big hall that she rents for different events and parties. In some occasions, Nieves provides catering service as well.

Nieves needs a 3000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan. The money will be invested in buying rice, beer, sugar and oil. Nieves dreams with expanding her hall, implement and offer more services, and that her children finish their professional studies.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nieves needs a 300 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that she will invest in buying rice, beer, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Bartola es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Bartola junto a su familia tienen un taller textil D. elaboración D. tejidos artesanales como alfombras, pasadizos, individuales, carteras, correas, actividad que realizan también sus hijos en sus horarios libres y cuenta con el apoyo D. varios empleados, sus ventas lo realizan en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. tiene 2 puestos en donD. expone sus bellos trabajos, además su esposo viaja a las diferentes ferias del país y también en algunas oportunidades viaja a países vecinos.

Bartola necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. hilos y lanas. Bartola sueña con tener una empresa más granD., D. exportación en mayor volumen y que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar sus profesiones.
texts.en:
Bartola is a member of the Communal Bank "Legión". Bartola is married, is 45 years old and has 4 children. Together with her family, Bartola owns a textile shop where they make artisan tapestries like rugs, table runners, table mats, wallets, and keychains. Her children help out in the business during their spare time, and she also has the help of a few employees. She sells her products at an artisan market in the city of Ayacucho, where she displays her beautiful work in her two shops. In addition, her husband travels to different fairs in the country and in some cases to neighboring countries to sell her products.

Bartola needs a loan of $375 USD. This money will be used to purchase thread and wool. Bartola dreams of owning a larger company, to export greater quantities of products, and hopes her children finish studying their respective majors.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bartola needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase thread and wool

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Victoria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Victoria junto a su esposo tienen un taller de reparación de carros, el taller esta ubicado en la asociación las Américas en local propio, Victoria al notar la demanda de repuestos implementó una pequeña tienda en su casa en donde vende repuestos que poco a poco esta surtiendo y también atendiendo la demanda de los clientes de su taller actualmente vende bebidas variadas.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos variados. Los sueños de Victoria son tener una tienda grande de venta de repuestos, construir su casa y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Legión community bank.

She lives with her husband, is 27 years old, and has one child. Victoria, with her husband, has a car repair shop situated in the association of Las Américas. It is their own store. Victoria, upon noticing the demand for spare parts started a small shop in her house where she sells spare parts where, little by little, she is building an inventory and, also to serve the demand of her shop’s clients, she now sells various drinks.

Victoria needs a loan of 1500 soles ($525) that she will invest in the purchase of new spare parts.

Victoria’s dreams are to have a large spare parts shop, to build a house, and for her son to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1500 soles ($525) that will be invested in the purchase of various spare parts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juana vende jugos de frutas que ella prepara al momento, actividad que realiza den el mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Juana inicio con este negocio hace 3 meses gracias a los consejos de su amiga y actualmente su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco. Anteriormente Juana vendía verduras en el mercado Las Américas donde sus ventas era mínimas y no tenia ingresos suficientes.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, leche, huevo y frutas. Los sueños de Juana son implementar otros negocios más rentables, tener una mototaxi y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Magnolia Microfinance Institute.

Juana is a 29-year-old woman who has a live-in partner and two children. Juana sells fresh fruit juice (prepared when it is ordered) at the F. Vivanco market, located in downtown Ayacucho. Juana started this business 3 months ago thanks to her friend’s advice. Her business is steadily increasing at the moment. She used to sell vegetables at the Las Américas market, but her sales were low and she did not earn enough income.

Juana needs a loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, milk, eggs, and fruit. Juana dreams of establishing more lucrative businesses, owning a motorcycle taxi, and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, milk, eggs, and fruit

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Felipa es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Felipa tiene una tienda al frente del mercado Playa Grau en donD. venD. condimentos chinos, comino, pimienta, ají, ajo, productos nacionales y también importados, su local es alquilado, Felipa viaja a la ciudad D. Lima cada quincena o dependiendo D. la demanda D. sus productos, para comprar sus productos. Actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas.

Felipa necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. comino y canela. Los sueños D. Felipa son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios, incrementar su negocio y comprar un local para realizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Comunal Bank "Primavera." Felipa is married, 52 years old and has 6 children. Felipa has a store across from the Playa Grau market where she sells chinese condiments, cumin, pepper, chili, garlic, natural products, imported products; her locale is rented. Felipa travels to Lima every 15 days or depending on the demand of her products, to buy her products. She sells these items with the help of her daughters. Felipa needs a loan for 1250 soles which will be invested in purchasing cumin and cinnamon. Felipa's dreams incluD. her children finishing their university studies, expanding her business and buying a locale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cumin and cinnamon

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, de céréales, depuis plus de 8 ans, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  Cette activité demeure sa principale source de revenus, et Enyonam désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mil, de haricots et d’arachides pour la revente. Elle espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Enyonam A. is a 42 year old married mother of five children. She has worked as a grain retailer for more than 8 years in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. This business is her main source of income and with her second FECECAV loan Enyonam wishes to grow her business capacity by purchasing bags of corn, millet, beans and peanuts for resale. With this opportunity she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of bags of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: Wari Wawas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Germán Buch, a este pertenece la asociación “Wari Wawas”. Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en habitaciones pequeñas, ya que los gastos que tienen para la manutención de sus hogares no les permiten poder pagar ambientes más grandes.
La actividad principal de ésta asociación es el comercio, que varia entre varios productos, por ejemplo; venta de CDS, venta de ropa, bisutería, alfombras, etc.
Ahora requieren mas capital para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad de ésta manera aumentar sus ganancias y obtener ingresos que les permita mejorar su forma de 
Vida.
texts.en:
The group Wari Waras belongs to the German Buch focal center which is located in the city of El Alto. This is a happy group which works responsibly with Pro-Mujer.

The majority of the women in the group are married and have large families. They live in small rented rooms since their expenses do not allow them to have more spacious spaces.

Commerce is the main business of this group. It varies from the sale of CDs, clothing, jewelry, carpets, etc. They need more capital in order to purchase merchandise in larger quantities so that they can increase their profits and obtain income that will allow them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale products.

loans.name: Martha Elvia

texts.es:
Martha Elvia es originaria de Cd. Solidaridad en Monterrey Nuevo León, ella se dedica a la venta de comésticos por catálogo. <

> Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de tres meses con pagos semanales para realizar el pago de mercancía de venta por catálogo. <

> Martha Elvia es una persona que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, ella tiene 5 hijos pequeños, es una mujer separada de su esposo y ante la necesidad de atender a sus pequeños ,y también de apoyar en el gastos familiar ,optó por desarrollar una actividad que le permitiera contar con una fuenta de ingresos y al mismo tiempo tener la disponibilidad de horario para estar al pendiente de su familia. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Martha Elvia por ser una persona que ha demostrado salir adelante por si misma! <

>

loans.use: Realizar pago de mercancía para venta de catálogo.

loans.name: Ollita De Barro Group

texts.es: Hace mas de cuatro años 14 personas  conforman la asociación “Ollita de Barro” que trabajan en el centro focal de Germán Buch que pertenece a Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida, trabajan con mucho empeño para alcanzar sus sueños. Una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación es la venta de fruta, para esto realizan viajes a Alto Beni y caranavi (localidades de La Paz) donde adquieren variedad de fruta de acuerdo a la temporada, Necesitan créditos para comprar frutas en mayores cantidades, de esta manera poder generar  mayores ingresos que les permita  fortalecer sus negocios y ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
For more than four years 14 people have made up the group “Ollita de Barro.” They work in the focal center German Buch which belongs to Pro-Mujer. They are convinced that they can improve their quality of life and work with much effort to reach their dreams. One of the most common business in this group is the sale of fruit for which they travel to Alto Beni and Caranavi (locations in La Paz) where they acquire a variety of seasonal fruit. They need this loan to purchase fruit in larger quantities in order to generate greater income that will allow them to strengthen their businesses and provide for the wellbeing of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit in greater quantities.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por 15 mujeres que adoptaron la denominación de “Progreso”. Esta asociación trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí   de  la ciudad de El Alto. La actividad principal esta centrada en el comercio de alimentos; Sonia vende carne cruda de cordero, Maruja vende carne de pollo , Lucia se dedica ala venta de verduras, todas ellas en general realizan sus ventas de forma ambulante, en los distintos mercados y calles de la ciudad de El Alto.
Necesitan capital para alquilar puestos fijos en mercados de la ciudad, de esta manera asegurar sus ventas y también mantener la  calidad de sus productos en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
This group, made up of 15 women, adopted the name “Progreso.” This group works in the focal center German Buch which is located in the Huayna Potosi zone in the city of El Alto. The group members’ main business is selling food. Sonia sells lamb meat, Maruja sells chicken and Lucia sells vegetables. They all sell their products as street vendors at different markets and in the streets of the city of El Alto. They need capital to rent fixed stalls in the markets in the city. This will allow them to secure their sales and to maintain the quality of their products in optimal conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring fixed stalls in city markets.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad cuenta con 45 años de edad, es una vendedora de productos de belleza de el Rancho La Reforma, comunidad localizada en Montemorelos Nuevo León.

Ella inició en el negocio de las ventas de productos de belleza hace 3 años, la idea de realizar esta actividad se debió principalmente a la necesidad de apoyar la economía familiar mediante la aportación de ingresos. La familia de Soledad se compone por su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$350 a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de productos de belleza.

¡Los invito a apoyar a Soledad para que pueda contribuir más al ingreso familiar de su hogar!
texts.en:
Soledad works at the age of 45 years old as a merchandiser of beauty products from Rancho La Reforma, a community located in Montemorelos Nuevo León. Presently she is requesting a loan for $350 over a period of four months to purchase beauty products. She began the business of beauty product sales three years ago. The idea of doing this activity came mainly from the need to support the family economy by contributing an income. The family of Soledad consists of her husband and her three children. I invite you to support Soledad so that she can contribute more to the family income!

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products.

loans.name: Nuevo Corazon Group

texts.es: 18 mujeres conforman  la asociación “Nuevo Corazón” que trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas tienen diversas actividades, venden refrescos, elaboran almuerzos, pero una actividad común entre ellas es la confección de ropa ligera (blusas, camisas, vestido) luego de su confección la venden en puestos fijos que tienen el la Ceja de El alto. Necesitan capital para la compra de maquinaria especial, para poder aumentar su producción, están seguras que con esta inversión, generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder  a sus créditos y mantener equilibrio económico en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Eighteen women make up the group “Nuevo Corazon.” They work in the German Buch focal center located in the Huayna Potosi zone in the city of El Alto. They have diverse businesses such as selling soft drinks and making lunches but a common business for all is making clothing (shirts, blouses, dresses). After the clothing is made, they sell it in stalls they have in the “Ceja” of El Alto. They need capital to purchase special machinery to increase their production. They are certain that with this investment they will generate greater income with which they will be able to repay their loans and maintain the economic equilibrium of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of special machinery for making clothing.

loans.name: Jahuas Pancarita Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Jahuas Pankarita” (Flores de Agua) trabaja en el centro focal de Villa   Exaltación que forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer, a la fecha  cuenta con 12 miembros que  han demostrado ser muy organizados y responsables en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, todas ellas económicamente, cuentan con el apoyo de sus parejas, pero los gastos que tienen en sus hogares son mayores a los ingresos de ambos por lo que deben esforzarse más en conseguir  estabilidad económica para sus hijos.
El comercio es una de  las actividades de la asociación Jahuas Pankatita, como ser la venta de verdura, fruta, cereales, por otra parte también algunas socias se dedican a la carpintería, realizan puertas, ventanas, mesas, entre otros.
Por lo general trabajan a pedido solamente. Necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima, con el fin de producir un stok de muebles para exponerlos y así obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
The association named “Jahuas Pankarita” (Water Flowers) works in the focal center of the village of Exaltación, which forms part of the Pro-Mujer family. To date, they have 12 members who have demonstrated how organized and responsible they are with respect to their loan payments and internal activities.

A majority of this group’s members are married and have children, almost all of whom are of school age. All of them count with the economic support of their partners; however, their living expenses are greater than their combined income which is why they must make a great effort to obtain financial stability for their children.

Vending is one of the activities of the Jahuas Pankarita, such as selling vegetables, fruits and cereals. On the other hand, some members dedicate themselves to carpentry and make doors, windows, and tables, among other items.

In general, they work solely on order. They need additional capital to buy raw materials with the goal of producing an inventory of furniture to put on display and in this way obtain greater sales.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need additional capital for the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Fatima 1 Group

texts.en:
The Fatima 1 group is maD. up of nine women and three men who live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The group members are involved in a variety of economic activities: they sell cosmetics, food, clothing and shoes, and work as seamstresses, taxi drivers, and construction workers. Most of the group members have between one and five years of experience in their respective businesses, with the exception of Richard and Carola (who work in construction and fruit sales, respectively), who each have fifteen years of experience.

Most of the group members say they plan to use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell or to buy tools for their businesses. This is the group's first loan cycle, though many of the members have had previous experience with group loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and tools for their businesses

loans.name: Ma. Emilia

texts.es:
Ma. Emilia es originaria de García Nuevo León, su actividad principal es la venta de paletas de hielo y de snacks en un establecimiento que se encuentra ubicado en su hogar. <

> Actualmente, solicta un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de seis meses, con la finalidad de surtir más y mejores mercancías. <

> Ma. Emilia empezó hace dos años vendiendo paletas de hielo casa por casa y frituras en la plaza principal, gracias a los buenos resultados obtenidos ya cuenta con un puesto en su casa. La idea de iniciar con la venta de paletas de hielo y snack se debe a la necesidad de apoyar a su familia mediante la contribución de un ingreso. La familia de Ma. Emilia se compone por su esposo y cinco hijos. Ante la temporalidad del empleo de su esposo, dado que se dedica a la albañilería, Ma. Emilia se ha preocupado por apoyarlo dado que a veces el pago que recibe por su trabajo no es muy alto y a veces el mismo trabajo es escaso. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Ma. Emilia para que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo! <

>

loans.use: Sustuir mercancía para la venta de paletas de hielo y snacks.

loans.name: Solidaridad Aa Group

texts.en:
The Solidaridad AA group consists of three men and 11 women who live in Sucre, in south-central Bolivia. Most of the group members are mothers of young children. They are involved in a variety of economic activities: sewing skirts and athletic clothing; selling cell phones; knitting shawls and sweaters; selling cookies, fruits and vegetables; driving taxis; selling beauty products and cosmetics; and running a neighborhood store. Most of the group members have between one and seven years of experience in their respective businesses, with the exception of Angela and Dora (who knit shawls and sweaters and sew athletic clothing, respectively), who both have more than fifteen years of experience.

Most of the group members will use their Kiva loans to buy more bulk merchandise to sell or to buy more raw materials for making clothing. This is the group's first loan. Their loan officer describes them as a very responsible and entrepreneurial group.

loans.use: Buy materials to make clothing or buy bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Las Señoras del banco Comunal con el nombre de las "Mujeres Trabajadores " del Paraje Coxom, del Cantón Patzarajmac, del Municipio y Departamento de Totonicapán mayores de edad,  Casadas, Hace más de cinco (5) años vienen trabajando de comerciantes, en la venta de cortes típicos y  otras  en la  venta de articulos de consumo diario en donde cuenta con variedad de productos la cual ha venido progresando y satisfaciendo la necesidad de ellas y la de los vecinos del paraje  y se  acercaron a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito grupal que será invertido para ampliar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción,  actualmente tramitan el segundo crédito donde han demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, ha este grupo de mujeres lamentablemente no acceden a un crédito bancario por la variedad de requisitos que se les imponen por lo que solicitan los servicios  de ASDIR.
texts.en:
The women of the Working Women Community Bank come from Paraje Coxom, Cantó Patzarajmac and Totonicapán and are married. They have been working as merchants for five years, some selling typical meats and others selling a variety of daily-use products, and they have continued progressing and satisfying their needs. They came to the offices of Kiva partner ASDIR to request a group loan that will increase their capital so they can afford to purchase more supplies for their businesses. Currently they are working on their second loan and have demonstrated responsibility in their repayments.
