The women of this association are married and each have children in their care. Their commercial activities vary from one member to the next and include selling rice, charcoal, generic pharmaceutical products, shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and grain. The income from their businesses enables them to come to the aid of their husbands regarding family expenses. The women have always gotten loans from WAGES and always make good on their payments. This fourth loan that the association is requesting will allow the purchase of 8 boxes of generic pharmaceutical products, 10 dozen shoes, 7 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential items, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeung P., 41, and her second husband, Mr. Chanthy Lau, 53, live along National Road Number 1, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993. Mrs Loeung has one son from her first husband, and her son studies in the local school.

Mrs. Loeung has been selling Chinese noodles and porridge since 2003. She cooks the food herself and sells it early in the morning in front of her house. Her husband has been a driving instructor for three years.

Loeung is requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a rest room in her family's home.

loans.use: To build one rest room to use in her family.

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklay C. (shown in the picture on the right with his wife and group members) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including him. All the group's members live along National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Soklay C., 53, and his wife, Mrs. Nara Sor, 47, were married in 1983 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children was married and lives away from the family, two children have full time employment and the youngest studies in the local school. Soklay has been a motor taxi driver for twenty years, while his wife stays at home. Soklay is requesting a $300 loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one, to be used as a taxi.

2-Mr. Rithy S., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Keo, 37, were married in 1987 and have two sons and two daughters. Rithy has been a motor taxi driver for ten years. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. Rithy is requesting a $200 loan to build a wall for his house.

3-Mr. Senghoir T., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-on Kuch, 25, were married in 2003 and have two sons. Senghoir has been a motor taxi driver for five years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Senghoir is requesting a $200 loan to repair his motorbike and some part of his house.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and repair house.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Dame F. PAULINE est née le 25 Janvier 1981 à POBE au BENIN. Mariée et sans enfant, elle vivait auprès de sa maman dame EMILOLA Ekpèbi et l'avait aidé pendant de nombreuses années dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Ayant pris goût à ce commerce, elle a continué sur la même lignée quand elle a rejoint son époux. Elle vend ses articles à crédit à ses clients et se charge dans un second temps de la collecte de ce qui est dû par ses clients en passant chez chacun d'eux. Dame F. Pauline distribue également des tissus. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour satisfaire ses clients combien nombreux et assez exigeants.
texts.en:
Pauline F., who was born on January 25, 1981 in Pobe, Benin, is married but has no children. She used to live with her mother Ekpebi Emilola, and for many years assisted her in selling kitchen utensils. Having acquired a taste for this trade, she has continued in this business since her marriage. She sells items to her customers on credit, taking it upon herself later to go door-to-door to collect what is owed to her. Mrs. F. also deals in cloth. She is seeking this loan to satisfy her customers, no matter the number, or however challenging their requirements might be.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 13 lengths of fabric of various quality, a dozen drinking glasses, a dozen ice chests, and 15 dozen saucepans

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. (pictured with her nephew) is a widow with one daughter, who lives in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sok has been a garment factory worker for over one year. She wants to create another business rearing pigs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase pigs for raising and to repair her nephew's motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase pig for raising and repair motorbike.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Mariée à M. KWASSI Ayi qui est un frigoriste, Dame D. Adjowa est née le 11 août 1969 à Lomé. Elle a deux enfants et a pour activité la vente des épices et de produits de premières nécessités au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2004 lui procure beaucoup de revenus.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 3 sacs, 4 bidons et 2 sacs de gingembre.
texts.en:
Married to Mr. Ayi Kwassi who is an expert in refrigeration, Mrs. Adjowa D. was born on April 11, 1969 in Lomé. She has two children and her business consists in selling spices and other staple goods in the big market of Lomé. This business which she opened in 2004 brings in a good income for her.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to refurbish her inventory by buying 3 sacks, 4 jerry cans, and 2 sacks of ginger.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spices and other staples for re-sale

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sngoun (the second from the left with her husband and group members) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including hers. All the group's members live along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. P. Sngoun, 40, and her husband, Mr. Phun Pich, 48, were married in 1983 and have five daughters. One of their children is married and lives away from the family home, three daughters have full time employment and the youngest one studies in the local school. P. has been a garment factory worker for five years, while her husband is a motor taxi driver and does construction work. P. is requesting a $300 loan to build a restroom for her family.

2-Miss. Sreylin T., 24, is single and lives with her widow mother. She has one sister who is a garment factory worker. Sreylin has been a garment factory worker for five years, while her mother grows rice. Sreylin is requesting a $300 loan to build a wall in her house.

3-Mr. Yin N., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Au, 50, were married before the Pol Pot regime and have one son and four daughters. Yin has been a fisherman for sixteen years. His wife is a housewife. Yin is requesting a $300 loanto buy a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle, repair house, and build one restroom.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akossiwa est née le 2 février 1958 à Kpalimé l’une des villes touristiques du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente du charbon de bois. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis1994 ce qui fait qu’elle est expérimentée dans ce commerce. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour aller s’approvisionner dans les villages d’Amou, localité dans laquelle abonde le charbon de bois. Ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born on February 2, 1958 in Kpalimé, one of the touristic towns in Togo. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her primary business activity consists in selling charcoal. She has been working at this business since 1994 which means that she is quite experienced in this line of work.

She is asking for this first loan to go to the villages of Amou, a locality that abounds in charcoal, to stock up. This loan will allow her to buy 14 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 14 sacks of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Allodjessi

texts.fr: Dame G. Allodjessi est née vers 1967 à Amoukonou dans la commune de KPOMASSE dans le département de l'Atlantique  de parents cultivateurs. Venue à Cotonou en 1985, elle s'est mise à préparer et vendre toute sorte de nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, pâte alimentaire accompagnés de diverses sauces telles que: légumes, graines, tomate etc...). Elle a démarré avec un fonds de roulement de 20 000 francs. Aujourd'hui, elle a un fonds de roulement d'environ 50 000 francs. De plus en plus sa clientèle s'accroît et elle désire mieux la satisfaire en variant les mets. C'est dans cette optique qu'elle a demandé son troisième crédit  à ALIDé pour faire des approvisionnements. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant du nom de Gontrand âgé de 16 ans et en classe de Troisième au cours secondaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Allodjessi G. was born around 1967 to rural parents in Amoukonou in the commune of Kpomasse in the Atlantique Department. Coming to Cotonou in 1985, she began to prepare and sell all sorts of food (maize porridge, rice, pasta, served with various sauces such as vegetables, grains, tomato, etc.) She got her business going with a working capital of 20,000 francs.

Today she has a working capital of about 50,000 francs. As she sees her clientele growing, she wants to do ever better at satisfying their demand by varying her dishes. It is with this intent that she is requesting her third loan from Alidé to stock up on raw materials. She is single and the mother of a child by the name of Gontrand, age 16 and in 10th grade, senior high school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of one sack of rice, 1/2 sack of corn, and 1 jerry can of 25 liters of oil

loans.name: Ama Sara

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Logopé dans la préfecture de golfe, madame A. Ama Sara est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Son activité consiste à faire la restauration du riz et la pâte d’igname communément appelée foufou dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006 et accueille beaucoup de clients jusqu’à nos jours. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 60 tubercules d’ignames et 10 sacs de riz.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Logopé in the Gulf Prefecture, Mrs. Ama Sara A. is married and the mother of one child. Her business consists in food service: cooked rice and yam porridge, commonly known as foufou, sold in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business in 2006 and still has lots of customers today. She has already received one loan and correctly reimbursed it.

This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 5 sacks of corn, 60 coco yams, and 10 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of corn (maize) and coco yams for food service

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: La señora Alberta, es una persona muy sencilla. Trabaja hace muchos años en el rubro, con lo cual, ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar necesarios para sobrevivir. Es una Señora muy trabajadora y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, muy dedicada a su familia y gracias a  su trabajo está sacando adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos,a quienes trara con mucho amor. Vive en una casa muy humilde, que no cuenta con los servicios básicos de sanidad.
texts.en:
Doña Alberta is a very modest person. She has been selling home products for many years supporting her husband in covering the necessary household expenses in order to survive. She is a very hard-working lady and responsible in covering her payments, she is very dedicated to her family and thanks to her work she is helping her two young children to get ahead treating them with love. She lives in a humble house without basic sanitation services.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Baptist Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Baptist Primary School, Magburaka. Baptist Primary School was founded by the Baptist Church in 1974.

Since its inception in 1974, this school lacked a formal building of its own. The school depended on renting one unfinished house after another. But thanks to the government, through a World Bank-sponsored programme they had their first building constructed in 1993 with only five classrooms. This was not enough, however, to host the growing number of pupils in the community; the school was, and still remains, the only primary school around the Back of Police Community. Thus in 2000, the United Nations Observers' Mission in Sierra Leone (UNOMSL) built them another five-classroom building.

Today, they are proud of two buildings with a well trained and qualified staff of eighteen. They have a very good record in terms of public examinations. They always achieve a record of 100% at the National Primary Schools Exams (NPSE).

This is their second loan from Kiva through SMT (Kiva’s Field Partner). The previous loan was a great success for these teachers. Some used their loans to attend to their children's schooling; others invested theirs in businesses or agriculture; and others used them for personal expenses, like purchasing furniture. Still others used their loans to start or finish the construction of a house.

Their head teacher, Mr. Henry S. K. (at the back left, in green), was one among those who invested their loans in building a house. That loan (Le 1,000,000), though small he said, helped him to start the construction of a house. With this new loan (Le 1,500,000), he will now be able to push the building process to another level. This is a great help to them, said Mr. Henry, who has been a teacher for the past 35 years. With a loan, each of the teachers will be able to handle a large sum of money in bulk, invest it in something great, and then repay gradually out of their meager salaries.

Mr. Henry is now 55 years of age. He was born in a village called Bumbuna, about 30 miles from Magburaka, the Tonkolili District head-quarter town, Northern Sierra Leone. He is married with three children, who are all still in school.

loans.use: To invest in business and agriculture, pay school fees, and use for house-building projects.

loans.name: Eufrin

texts.es: El señor Eufrin es un cliente muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, vive con su familia en una casa muy sencilla y humilde que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos de sanidad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y con esa actividad mantiene a su familia, debido a que en la actualidad es su unico medio de ingreso, porque hace mucho tiempo que no puede conseguir un trabajo formal. Sin embargo él trabaja con muchas ganas para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eufrin is a very responsible cliente and dedicated to his work. He lives with his family in a simple and humble home that has all the basic sanitary services. He sells used clothing and with this work he supports his family, which is the only source of income because it has been a long time since he has been able to find regular work. Nevertheless he works tirelessly to improve the quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for used clothing business

loans.name: Amélée

texts.fr: Dame N. Amélée est née vers 1962 à Athiémé dans le département du MONO. Elle est mariée à DJOSSOU Etienne et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés( Falienne et Audrey). Elle habite Sikécodji, un quartier de Cotonou depuis plus de 25 ans. Dame  N. Amélée fait toute sorte de bouillie qu'elle revend accompagné des accessoires depuis 4 ans. Elle  fait aussi la distribution vente depuis 6 ans et c'est pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qu'elle vient solliciter son quatrième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. Amélée N. was born around 1962 in Athiémé in the county of MONO. She is married to Etienne DJOSSOU and is the mother of two children (Falienne and Audrey), who are both in school. She has been living in Sikécodji, a district of Cotonou, for over 25 years and has been making all kinds of porridge that she sells, along with incidentals, for four years. She has also been doing sales distribution for six years. And to meet the demands of her customers, she has come to request her fourth loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of flour, a drum of vegetable oil, a sack of sugar, some lengths of pagne, and basins

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr: Né le 24/05/1982 à Sainte Cécile, un quartier de la capitale économique du BENIN,  monsieur D. Donatien est photographe de formation et exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans. Il est marié à DANDJINOU Adèle et est père d'un enfant ( Marina âgé d'un an). Il a démarré petit à petit et dispose aujourd'hui de  son atelier à Tokpa, le plus grand marché de la sous-région, où lui même habite depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est pour satisfaire au mieux ses clients dans les activités de photographie qu'il a sollicité ce prêt. Il est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on May 24th, 1982 in Sainte Cécile, a neighborhood in the economic capital of Benin, Mr. Donatien D. is a trained photographer and has been in business for seven years. He is married to Adèle Dandjinou and is the father of one child, Marina, who is one-year old. He slowly worked his way up in the industry and now runs his own shop in Topka, the largest marketplace in the region, where he has lived for about 10 years. He is requesting this loan so he can adequately respond to customer demand. This is his fourth loan with ALIDE.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of photography materials

loans.name: Antonia Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Antonia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas” ubicado en Jr: Mariano Melgar Mz.D Lt.6 AA.HH. 28 de Marzo del distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad, Antonia cuenta  con 1 motokar, el cual lo pone a trabajar todos los días y de esa manera conseguir ingresos para pagar puntualmente el préstamo.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de la motokar y comprará 3 llantas, tapizada de asiento, cambio de toldo y otros.  
   
Antonia se siente una mujer independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos, además de estar agradecida por tener confianza en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is a member of the "Banco Comunal Las Paykanas", located in Jr: Mariano Melgar Mz.D Lt.6AA.HH. 28 de Marzo, District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old, a mother of 3 young children who still depend on her, she is married and her husband works as a carpenter. With a previous loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.l300 she invested in dairy products. At the present Antonia has 1 motorcar which is being worked daily and that way she receives income to repay her loan punctually. With this loan of S/.2,200, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in fixing the motorcar and buy 3 tires, upholster the seats, and change the roof, among others. Antonia feels independent thanks to the support from Manuela Ramos and she is also very thankful for the trust put in her.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IInvest in maintenance and fixing a motorcar.

loans.name: Carmen Norma

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr: Manco Cápac Nº 669 AA.HH. Jorge Chávez Ucayali, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de recaudador. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00, decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Carmen tiene 5 años participando en Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad, Carmen es docente de Educación Inicial,  trabaja por la mañana y cuenta con una bodega. Se levanta temprano para realizar sus actividades y poder salir a trabajar. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, etc., ya que le brinda ganancias y así podrá pagar puntualmente el préstamo.

Carmen manifiesta que Manuela Ramos ayuda a mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras. Se siente feliz y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the communal bank “La Lupuna”, which is located in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 50 years old, and is the mother of four adult children. She is married, and her husband works as a tax collector. She decided to invest her first loan of 300.00 soles into the sale of groceries. She has participated in Manuela Ramos for five years.

Currently, Carmen is a primary school teacher who works in the mornings. She also has a grocery store. She rises early each day to finish complete her tasks and be able to leave to go to work.

With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will invest in the purchase of more groceries. Specifically, 1 bag of sugar, 1 box of milk, 1 bag of rice, etc., given that these bring her earnings and this way she will be able to be punctual with her loan repayments.

Carmen says that Manuela Ramos helps women who are fighters and hard workers. She feels happy and wants to continue arising in life.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries (sugar, milk, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Dame G. Jeanne est née vers 1963 à Lomé au Togo, un pays voisin au Bénin. Elle est mariée à GBOHOUI Etienne avec qui elle vit au Bénin. Elle est mère de 05 enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge des deux parents. Elle vend des articles divers tels que: du sucre en poudre, des séchoirs à mains etc... C'est pour répondre à la demande de ses clients qu'elle a sollicité  son troisième  prêt. Elle habite le quartier Ladji depuis plusieurs années où elle mène ses activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeanne G. was born around 1963 in Lomé, Togo, a country neighboring Bénin. She is married to Etienne GBOHOUI with whom she lives in Bénin. She is the mother of five children, all attending school and in the care of their two parents. She sells various articles, such as: powdered sugar, hand dryers, etc. She has requested her third loan to respond to the demands of her customers. She has been living in the Ladji district where she works for several years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dryer, irons, and various other items

loans.name: Elsa Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en la Av. Laureano Del Águila Mz.A Lt.1, distrito D. Yarinacocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijas mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como policía. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. costura.
 
En la actualidad, Elsa, continúa con el negocio D. costura “venta D. ropas” para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 10 metros D. tela para muebles, 8 kilos D. tela para blusas, tela para vestidos, camisas, blondas y otros. 

Elsa es trabajadora, empeñosa y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida agradeciendo siempre a Dios y a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas,” located on the Laureano Del Águila Mz.A Lt.1 Avenue, Yarinacocha district, Ucayali state. She is 54 years old, mother to 3 grown daughters, she is married and her husband works as a police officer. With the first loan she received for S/.300 she decided to invest in a seamstress business. Today Elsa continues her business selling clothing for women, men and children. With this loan for S/.1,500 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 10 meters of furniture fabric, 8 kilos of blouse fabric, fabric for dresses, shirts, silk lace and other fabric. Elsa is hard-working and she wishes to continue be successful in life, always thanking God and also Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es: Francisco  a sus 33 años de edad, es pintor profesional con diecinueve años de experiencia. Actualmente habita en el barrio San Judas, es casado, tienen tres hijos menores de edad, que estudian la primaria. Su esposa trabaja en ventas varias y así apoyar a Francisco con los gastos del hogar. Con el préstamo solicitado hará mejoras a su hogar,  levantará dos paredes y cambiará el techo ya que esta en muy mal estado y quiere poner zinc nuevo, para así tener una vivienda más segura para su familia, ya que su dificultad ha sido poder terminar de hacer su vivienda y lo que el anhela es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, at 33 years old, is a professional painter with 19 years of experience. Today he lives in the San Judas neighborhood, is married, and has three children in primary school. His wife works in sales and inthis way supports Francisco wtih the household expenses. With the loan he will make improvements to his home, putting up two walls and he will change the roof as it is in poor codition and he wants to put new zinc in order to have a safer home for his family. It has been difficult for him to finish his home and what he longs for is being able to have a worthy home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two walls and change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aves Fénix”, ubicado en Jr: Huancavelica Nº 146, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 73 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, vive con su nieta y con su hijo mayor, el cual trabaja como contador en el Concejo D. Pampa Hermosa. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas.

En la actualidad, Esther cuenta con la venta D. pasamanería (lapiceros, cinta D. embalaje, papel bond, fólder manila, correctores, etc.).

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, y con el apoyo D. su hijo, invertirá en la compra D. 4 cajas D. lapiceros, 3 cajas D. correctores, papel bond, 2 cajas D. borradores, etc.
   
Esther es una mujer alegre y manifiesta que gracias al banco comunal D. Manuela Ramos y a Dios el negocio ha mejorado y considera ser una persona totalmente feliz.
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the Communal Bank “"Las Aves Fénix," located at Jr: Huancavelica Nº 146, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 73 years old, mother to 5 grown children, she lives with her granddaughter and oldest son, who works as an accountant in the Pampa Hermosa Council. With the first loan that he received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 soles, he decided to invest in selling candy. Today, Esther sells supplies (pens, packaging tape, bond paper, manila folders, erasers, etc.). With this loan for S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, and with the support of her son, she will invest in buying 4 boxes of pens, 3 boxes of markers, bond paper, 2 boxes of erasers, etc. Esther is a happy woman and expresses her thanks to the Communal Bank of Manuela Ramos and God that her business has improved and she considers herself to be a totally happy person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pens, markers, bond paper, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Reyna Belén

texts.es: Reyna es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 12 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la sastrería y siempre está pendiente que a su familia no le falte nada. Reyna trabaja en una zona franca de Managua, en el departamento de control de calidad de corte y confección. A través de su esposo obtuvo la mayoría de conocimientos que tiene, y a través de una buena referencia obtuvo el trabajo que ahora tiene. El préstamo solicitado será usado en el cambio de zinc de su vivienda, ya que el que tienen actualmente está en mal estado y se están viendo afectados por las lluvias de este invierno.
texts.en:
Reyna is married, has three children ages 4, 12 and 15. Her husband works as a tailor and is always aware to make sure that his family has everything they need. Reyna works for a company in Managua, in the tailoring quality control department. She gained most of her knowledge from her husband and with a good reference she was able to get her current job. The loan provided will be used in changing the zinc sheets on the roof of her house, because they are currently in bad condition which is affecting them because of the winter rain.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof of her house

loans.name: Flor Esther

texts.es:
La señora Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr. Walter Adriansen Mz A Lt 3 AA. HH. Las Brisas del Ucayali, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 de ellos mayores de edad y 2 dependen aún de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte terrestre, maneja una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300.00, decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Ya tiene 5 años participando en Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad, Flor es docente de Educación Secundaria y además cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa a domicilio. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo y de sus 2 mayores hijas.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalones, 460 piezas, 150 piezas de polos para damas, caballeros y niños. Este negocio le brinda ganancias y le permite pagar puntualmente el préstamo.

Flor manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres. Se siente feliz y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Flor belongs to the "La Lupina" communal bank, located at Jirón Walter Adriansen MZ A Lt3 AA.HH. Las Brisas del Ucayali, in the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children; 2 are adults and 2 are still dependent on her. She is married and her husband drives a motokar” (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi). With the first loan she received for S/. 300, she decided to invest in selling groceries. She has been participating in Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Currently Flor is a secondary school teacher and she also has her own business selling clothing door to door. She has the support of her husband and her 2 older daughters. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in purchasing clothing such as pants, 460 pairs, and 150 jerseys for women, men and children. The business gives her income and allows her to repay her loans on time. Flor says that Manuel Ramos is of help to all women. She is happy and hopes to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Hindou

texts.fr:
Dame S. Hindou est née le 31 décembre 1979 à Badou, localité dans laquelle abonde la banane. Actuellement elle réside à Agoè et s’est mariée à monsieur WADJANA qui est un chauffeur. Elle a deux enfants qui font le cours primaire. Elle fait le commerce de cola et de gingembre au grand marché de Lomé, activité qu’elle a commencé depuis 2004.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 04 sacs de cola et de 06 sacs de gingembre.
texts.en:
Ms. Hindou S. was born on December 31, 1979 in Badou, a town where bananas abound. She currently resides in Agoè and is married to Mr. WADJANA, who is a driver. She has two children attending primary school. She has been doing commerce in cola nuts and ginger at the grand marketplace of Lomé since 2004. This initial loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy four sacks of cola nuts and six sacks of ginger.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cola nuts and ginger

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 38 años de edad, habita Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 7 y12 años de edad. Rosa Argentina trabaja en una institución del gobierno que se llama SEIT Internacional, desempeñándose como encuestadora, tiene cuatro años de experiencia en esta área, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos pero ante la necesidad de más ingresos para mantener a su familia decidió buscar un trabajo fijo. El préstamo lo requiere para hacer la construcción de un baño en su vivienda, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como bloques, arena, cemento y hierro.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 38 years old and lives in Hialeah, Managua. She is single and has two children, who are 7 and 12 years old. Rosa Argentina works in a government institution that is called SEIT International, acting as a pollster. She has four year of experience in this area. Earlier, she sold cosmetics but because of the necessity of a higher income to support her family, she decided to look for a fixed job. The loan is required so that she can build a bathroom in her home. For this, she needs to buy materials like blocks, sand, cement, and iron.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Georgina Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Georgina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aves Fénix”, ubicado en Jr. Eduardo del Águila Nº 796, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 pequeñas menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Auxiliar Contable. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la costura.

En la actualidad, Georgina cuenta con la venta de bebidas naturales como cebada, chicha de maíz, néctar y también cuenta con otra mercadería para vender, ropa.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 kilos de cebada, 4 kilos de maíz morado y luego comprará ropa para niños. 
   
Georgina manifiesta que recibe un apoyo de Manuela Ramos y está muy agradecida y contenta por pertenecer al banquito “Las Aves Fénix”.
texts.en:
Señora Georgina belongs to the "Phoenix Birds" Community Bank located in Jr. Eduardo del Águila Nº 796 in the district of Callería and the department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and the mother of two small children who are still dependent on her. She is also married, and her husband works as an Accounting Assistant. With the first S/.300 loan that Georgina received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in crafts. At present, Georgina sells natural drinks like cebada (made from barley), chicha de maíz (a corn-based fermented drink), juices and other merchandise such as clothing. With this loan of S/.1,300 ($450), which will be termed in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 3 kilos of barley and 4 kilos of black maize. Later, she will purchase clothing for her children . Georgina expresses her gratitude in receiving the help of Manuela Ramos, and is happy to belong to the "Phoenix Birds" community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de cebada, maíz morado y ropa para niños.

loans.name: Verónica Asunción

texts.es: Doña Verónica es casada, con una hermosa familia de cinco hijos, con edades de 6, 8, 9,10 y 15 años de edad, habitan en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo, tiene 38 años de edad, y su esposo trabaja como soldador. Doña Verónica trabaja con su esposo en la administración del taller de soldadura que iniciaron con capital propio desde hace quince años, ella es la encargada de control de inventario y de las compra de materia prima, también ayudan su hijo de quince años y dos trabajadores. Esperan que el negocio pueda seguir creciendo como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, y así poder dar servicios a más clientes y mejorar el servicio de los clientes que están con ellos. Necesitan hacer una inversión en su vivienda como es la instalación del techo para eso necesitan comprar perlines y zinc es por eso el motivo del préstamo
texts.en:
Verónica is 38 years old and is married with five beautiful children ages 6, 8, 9, 10 and 15. Her husband works as a welder and they live in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood. Veronica works with her husband in the administration of the welding shop which they established with their own capital 15 years ago. She is in charge of inventory control and of purchasing prime materials. Her 15 year old son and two workers also help at the shop. They hope that the business can continue to grow as it has been until now so that they can provide more services and improve the services to their clients. They need to invest in their home by installing a roof which is why they need this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a roof in part of their home.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Dame G. Pascaline est née vers 1973 à Aguégué. Elle est mariée à TANDE Sègbégnon qui est vendeur de sable fluvial et est mère de 3 enfants tous à la charge des deux parents. Elle revend du poissons au marché Saint Michel de Cotonou. Ses clients devenu encore plus exigeants, elle avait sollicité un premier crédit pour faire face à leur demande. Aujourd'hui elle est à son quatrième crédit. Elle est analphabète et est née dans le commerce de poissons, ce qu'elle même fait depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle habite  Ladji depuis 15 ans et fait aussi la distribution vente de quelques articles que ses clients désirent.
texts.en:
Pascaline G. was born about 1973 in Aguegue. She is married to Segbegnon Tande, who sells river sand, and she and her husband have three children. Pascaline sells fish at the Saint Michel market in Cotonou. She requested her first loan to meet the ever-increasing needs of her customers, and now is on her fourth loan. She is illiterate, and was born into the fish trade, a business in which she has worked for more than 20 years. She has lived in Ladji for the past 15 years and in addition trades in other items her customers might want.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr. La Paz Mz. A Lt. 18 AA.HH. Violeta Correa del distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 3 años trabajando con al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad, Juana continua con el mismo negocio de venta de ropa a domicilio y también cuenta con la venta de arroz, sal y fideos al por mayor. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 4 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de sal, 4 paquetes de fideos y ropa usada, ya que ese negocio le brinda mayores ganancias.
   
Juanita agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo y promete pagar puntualmente el préstamo que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana belongs to Las Paykanas Communal Bank, located on Jr. La Paz Mz. A Lt. 18 AA.HH, Violeta Correa in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali. She is 35 years old, is the mother of 5 children that still depend on her, is married, and her husband is involved in the exportation of wood. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of used clothes. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos community bank for three years.

At present, Juana continues to sell clothes door-to-door and also counts on the sale of rice, salt, and noodles at wholesale.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, and 4 packets of noodles, and used clothes, since this business offers her a good income.

Juanita gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for the support and promises to repay the loan that they offered her punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, salt, noodles, and used clothes

loans.name: Kaly Sarqui

texts.es:
La señora Kaly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aves Fénix”, ubicado en Jr. Huancavelica Nº 152, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 hermosas niñas menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la docencia, es Profesor de Matemática. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de bolsones a croché y macramé hechos a mano.
	
En la actualidad, Kaly es profesora de taller, cuenta con el mismo negocio y confecciona zapatos para señoritas y niñas. Usualmente se levanta temprano para confeccionar sus carteras, bolsones, zapatos y apoyar a sus hijas. 

Con el préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una maquina de coser zapatos, 6 metros de viocuero o cuero mojado, 6 metros de  forro transpirante, 2 metro de tela, pegamento, terocal, etc.  
   
Kaly se volvió una mujer de negocios con la ayuda de su familia, de Manuela Ramos y sobre todo con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kaly belongs to the "Las Aves Fénix" Communa Bank, which is located at Jr. Huancavelica #152 in the Calleria District of Ucayali Department. She is 35 years old and the mother of two beautiful young girls, who are still dependents. She is married, and her husband is a math teacher. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in handmade macrame and crocheted bags to sell.

Kaly currently teaches a workshop, runs her bag-making business and also makes shoes for young women and girls. She usually wakes up early to make wallets, bags, shoes, and support her daughters.

With this loan of 1,300 soles (which she will repay in four months) Kaly will buy a machine to sew shoes, six meters of leather, six meters of clear lining, two meters of fabric, and different kinds of glue.

Kaly became a businesswoman with the help of her friends, Manuela Ramos, and above all, God.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine for shoes, leather and fabric

loans.name: Solange Eudoxie

texts.fr: Dame M. Solange Eudoxie est née le 02/03/1967 à Cotonou. Elle est coiffeuse de profession; activité qu'elle exerce depuis 10ans. Elle est mariée à BEKOU Elie qui  est commerçant et qui réside en Allemagne. Elle est mère de 2 enfants ( Nadine et Ebénézer) tous scolarisés et respectivement en classe de 1ère et de 5 ème année du cours primaire. Dame M. Solange Eudoxie vit avec ses enfants en location. C'est pour faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle qu'elle a sollicité ce crédit car seule, elle ne dispose pas de moyens financiers suffisants pour satisfaire aux exigences des nombreuses femmes qui viennent se coiffer chez elle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Solange Eudoxie M. was born March 2nd, 1967 in Cotonou. She is a hair stylist by profession, a business activity she's been doing for the last ten years. She is married to Elie BEKOU who is a trader living in Germany. She is the mother of two children (Nadine and Ebenezer) who are both getting an education, in first and fifth year respectively, at primary school. Mrs. Solange Eudoxie M. lives with her children in rented accommodation. She is seeking this loan to meet the needs of her customers because on her own, she doesn't have sufficient financial means to satisfy demand from the many women who come to her to have their hair done.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic hair extensions, electric hair dryer, and hair care products

loans.name: Karina Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr. La Gloriosa Mz.C Lt 1 AA.HH. Ulises Reategui, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas.

En la actualidad, Karina cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se levanta temprano para cumplir con los deberes del hogar, apoyar a su pequeña hija y atender el negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como un saco de arroz, una vitrina para la venta de pan, un saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche gloria, un paquete de fideos, una bolsa de detergente y verduras.
   
Karina se volvió una mujer trabajadora, exitosa y con muchas ganas de vivir. Agradece al banco comunal por brindarle la oportunidad de realizarse como mujer y de progresar en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina belongs to the La Lupuna Communal Bank, which is located in the Jr. La Gloriosa Mz.C Lt 1 AA.HH, Ulises Reategui, in the Yarinacocha District of Ucayali Department. She is 29 years old and the mother of one young child who is still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband is a woodworker. With her first 300 sole loan from Manuela Ramos, she bought sweets to sell. Karina currently has a small store in her home. She wakes up early to do chores, take care of her daughter and attend to her store. With this loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy dry goods like a sack of rice, a glass counter for bread, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of Gloria brand milk, a pack of noodles, a bag of detergent, and vegetables.

Karina has become a hard-working, successful woman who enjoys life. She is thankful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to fulfill her dreams as a woman and advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dry goods (rice, sugar, milk) and a glass display counter

loans.name: Leli

texts.es:
La señora Leli pertenece al Banco Comunal “La  Lupuna”, ubicado en el AA.HH La Telefónica  Mz.A Lt.47, distrito de Yarinacocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 4 años en el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la cosmetología (corte de cabello, ondulaciones, peinados), también vende gaseosas, hielo y otros. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000 el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, comprará 3 espejos, 5 frascos de liquido, 4 tijeras, 1 máquina peluquera y 1 docena de peines para ampliar mejor el negocio 

Leli se volvió una mujer trabajadora con ganas de seguir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos y está muy contenta de pertenecer al banquito de Manuela Ramos y por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Leli belongs to the Communal Bank “La Lupuna,” located at AA.HH La Telefónica Mz.A Lt.47, Yarincocha district, Ucaylai state. She is 35 years old, married, her husband works as a lumber cutter. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/ 300.00 she decided to invest in selling food. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank for 4 years. Today she is a cosmetologist (she cuts hair, perms, hair styling), she also sells beverages, ice and more. With this loan for S/.2,000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 3 mirrors, 5 bottles of liquid, 4 scissors, 1 hair dryer and 1 dozen combs to expand and improve her business. Leli turned into a hard working woman with the desire to be successful for the benefit of his children and she is very content to belong to the small bank through Manuela Ramos and for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mirrors, scissors, hair dryer, combs, etc.

loans.name: Lidia Cledy

texts.es:
L. señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz:L Lt.17, distrito D. Yarinacocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es madre D. 1 hijo que aún depenD. D. elL., es casada y su esposo es profesor jubilado. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en L. venta del  producto AVON (producto D. belleza). Tiene 8 años en ManueL. Ramos.
 
En L. actualidad continua con el negocio D. venta D. productos AVON, a L. vez  empezó comprando pollos y gaseosas al por mayor para vender y enviarlo al río Alto Ucayali. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en L. compra D. los  productos AVON, también comprará 100 pollos y 80 cajas D. gaseosas.  

Lidia manifiesta que recibe un apoyo incondicional D. ManueL. Ramos y agradece al banco comunal por L. ayuda y por L. confianza que depositaron en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia belongs to the Las Brisas ("The Breezes") Communal Bank, located at Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz:L Lt.17 in the Yarinacocha District of the Ucayali Department. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of one son. Her husband is a retired teacher, and their son is still a dependent. With her first loan from ManueL. Ramos of 300 soles (about US $100), she decided to buy AVON beauty products. She has been working with ManueL. Ramos for eight years. Lidia still sells AVON products, and has also started to buy chickens and soda in bulk to sell and send to the Alto Ucayali River area. With this loan of 1,800 soles (US $600), which she will repay in four months, Lidia will buy more AVON products, 100 chickens and 80 crates of soda. Lidia says that she receives unconditional support from ManueL. Ramos, and is grateful to the communal bank for the help they have given her and the trust they have placed in her.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon beauty products, 100 chickens and 80 crates of soda

loans.name: Lalpome Yandja

texts.fr:
Monsieur L. Lalpome Yandja est né le 31 décembre 1975 à Naki ouest dans la préfecture de Tône à l’extrême nord du Togo. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il est soudeur de profession. Il a ouvert son atelier de soudure dans le quartier d’Agoè à lomé. Son activité consiste à fabriquer les portails, les meules et à réparer les véhicules.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’acquitter des outils de travail tels que 25 lames de tôles, 10 paquets de baguettes  et 5 paires de meules. Avec ces outils, il pourra mieux faire son travail et tirer beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Lalpome Yandja L. was born on December 31, 1975 in Naki-Ouest in Tône Prefecture, in the far north of Togo. He is married, the father of three children, and a welder by profession. He has opened his welder's workshop in the Agoè district of Lomé. His business consists of making gates and grindstones and of repairing vehicles. He is requesting this initial loan to pay off work tools, such as 25 strips of sheetmetal, 10 packets of rods, and 5 pairs of grindstones. With these tools, he will be able to do his work better and to derive a good deal of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Madeleine Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria  Mz.A Lt.22, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de niñas menores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte terrestre, manejo un auto. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, decide invertir en mantenimiento de jardines en diferentes viviendas, escuelas, etc.
 
En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de mantenimiento, ampliación, instalación y cuidado de áreas verdes, jardines. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 tijera podadora, 5 palas, 1 escalera y otros.

Madeleina es una mujer trabajadora y está feliz con todo lo que ha logrado y realizado.
texts.en:
Señora Madeleine belongs to the Las Brisas ("The Breezes") Communal Bank, located on Universitaria Ave, Mz.A Lt.22, in the Yarinacocha District of Ucayali Department. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of several girls who are still minors. Her husband works in transportation and drives a car. With Madeleine's first loan 0f 300 soles (US $100) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in garden maintenance at a variety of homes and schools.

She is still involved in this business: she does garden installations, maintenance, expansion, and cares for gardens and green areas.

With this loan of 2,000 soles (US $675), which she will repay in four months, Madeleine will buy one pair of pruning shears, five shovels, a ladder and other items she needs for her work.

Madeleine is a hard-working woman, and is pleased with all that she has done and achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a ladder, pruning shears and shovels

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Dame O. Angèle est née le 23/05/1962 à Agonli. Elle a épousé à ADEOTI Henri et est mère de 05 enfants. Elle habite le quartier Sainte Rita depuis 3 ans et fait la distribution vente depuis un an. Elle revendait de l'huile d'arachide mais elle a très tôt abandonné cette activité au profit de la distribution vente. Elle vient solliciter son cinquième prêt à ALIDé pour satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Angèle O. was born on May 23, 1962 in Agonli. She married Henri ADEOTI and is the mother of five children. She has been living in the Sainte Rita district for three years and has been doing sales distribution for one year. Having sold peanut oil in the past, she very early on abandoned it for her work in sales distribution. She has come to request her fifth loan with Alidé to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 12 dozen women's shoes, twenty-some kitchen utensiles, and various household products

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Née à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto, dame A. Afiwa est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit actuellement avec son mari et réside dans le quartier Agoè. Elle a pour activité la vente des céréales, du piment et du poisson fumé. Elle commencé cette activité depuis 1997 et vend à domicile et dans les marchés d’Agoè et d’adétokopé village situé à 15km de lomé. Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et contribue beaucoup au paiement des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 8 sacs de maïs et 2 sacs de piment et 4 paniers de poissons fumés.
texts.en:
Born in Tabligbo in Yoto Prefecture, Ms. Afiwa A. is married and the mother of three. She currently lives with her husband in the Agoè district. Her work involves selling grain, chili peppers, and smoked fish. She has been doing this work since 1997 and sells out of her home and in the marketplaces of Agoè and Adétokopé, a village located 15 km from Lomé. She helps her husband cover family expenses and contributes greatly to paying the school fees for her children. She is requesting this initial loan for getting supplies by purchasing eight sacks of corn, two sacks of chili peppers, and four baskets of smoked fish.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish, chili peppers, and corn

loans.name: Maria Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz.Ñ Lt.4 AA.HH. Pedro Portillo, distrito D. Yarinacocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad, es madre D. 8 hijos, los cuales son mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo es pensionista. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300.00, deciD. invertir en el pago D. su producto “Ebel” (producto D. belleza).

En la actualidad continua con la venta D. Ebel, confecciona zapatos, carteras, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. También cose sábanas, toallas pequeñas y otras prendas.    

Con este préstamo actual D. S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 6 kilos D. tela, 5 piezas D. cuerina, ½ docena D. plantilla, 5 unidades D. hilo D. croché, etc.

Maria manifiesta que recibe el apoyo D. Manuela Ramos porque el negocio mejoró y a la vez agradece a Dios por la oportunidad que le brinda la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the La Lupuna Communal Bank, located on Jr. José Olaya Mz.Ñ Lt.4 AA.HH, Pedro Portillo in the Yarinacocha in Ucayali. She is 59 years old, is the mother of 8 children, who are of legal age, is married, and her husband is retired. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she decided to invest in the payment of her product “Ebel” (a beauty product).

At present, she continues selling Ebel, making shoes and wallets for women, men, and children. She also sews sheets, small towels, and other garments.

With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 6 kilograms of fabric, 5 pieces of synthetic leather, half a dozen patterns, 5 units of crochet thread, etc.

Maria shows that she receives the support of Manuela Ramos because the business improved and, at the same time, she gives thanks to God for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fabric, synthetic leather, patterns, crochet thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Rosly

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz.A Lt.1 PJ. José Olaya, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 de ellos mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja de obrero en la municipalidad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad, Maria cuenta con 3 motokar, los cuales son las herramienta de trabajo que le generan ganancias para cumplir con sus gastos y responsabilidades.    

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de 2 de sus motokar, los cuales los tapizará a un costo de S/. 300 cada tapizada y en el arreglo del motor a un costo de S/.150 cada motor. 
   
Maria se siente una mujer triunfadora. Agradece a Manuela Ramos y sobre todo a Dios por brindarle grandes oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria H. is a member of the “Las Paykanas” microfinance institute, located on Ave. Miraflores Mz. A Lt.1 PJ. José Olaya, in the Yarinacocha district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years of age and has 4 children, 2 of whom are adults, and 2 of whom are still her dependants. Her husband works as a laborer in the municipality. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos in dairy product sales.

Maria currently owns 3 motorcycle taxis, which are her work tools that generate earnings that cover the household expenses.

She will utilize this loan of 1,200.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, to repair 2 of her motorcycle taxis. She will upholster them at a cost of 300.00 PEN each, and repair the engine for 150.00 PEN each.

Maria feels like a triumphant woman. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, but aboveall, to God, for giving her such great opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair two of her motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
La señora Norma  pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna” ubicado en el AA. HH. La Flor de la Lupuna, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 4 menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es negociante independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en lencería, cose variedades de ropa interior. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se levanta muy temprano para realizar las actividades del hogar, atender a sus hijos y al negocio, de esa manera poder pagar puntualmente el préstamo.    

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como 1 saco de papa, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de carbón, 2 cajas de leche, 1 paquete de fideos, 1 paquete de gaseosa grande y verduras.
   
Gracias a Dios y a Manuela Ramos el negocio se ha ampliado y ha mejorado su economía para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the communal bank “La Lupuna”, located in the Yarinacocha district of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, the mother of four minor children who still depend on her, and married. Her husband is an independent businessman. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in lingerie, sewing a variety of underclothes.

Currently, she has a grocery store in her house. She rises very early to take care of the household chores, her children and the business, so she can pay her loan installments on time.

With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, to be repaid over five months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries such as 1 sack of potatoes, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of charcoal, 2 crates of milk, 1 package of noodles, 1 large package of sodas, and vegetables.

Thanks to God and to Manuela Ramos, the business has grown and improved her finances to the benefit of her family.

.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries (potato, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Adzowa

texts.fr: Madame A. Adzowa est née le 07 juillet 1958 à Kpalimé ville située à 120 Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et a 8 enfants à charge. Elle a ouvert un pressing qu’elle a nommée « LAVAGE A SEC LA CONFIANCE ». Depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité, elle n’a cessé de recevoir la visite de bon nombre de clients car elle maîtrise et fait bien son travail. Les machines qu’elle utilise sont actuellement en panne et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à laver et un fer à repasser.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adzowa A. was born on July 7, 1958 in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé. She is married and has 8 children for whom she is responsible. She has opened a cleaners that she calls "Confidence Cleaners".

Ever since she opened up this business, she has not ceased to have plenty of customers since she is very good at her work. The machines she uses are presently broken and she is requesting this first loan to acquire a washing machine and an iron.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a washing machine and an iron

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Dame D. Agnès est née le 17/12/1957 à Abomey, l'une des villes historiques du Bénin à Sota dans l'Arrondissement de Sinhoué. Elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant nommé Crédo KOUCHIKO.  Elle habite le quartier de Djidjè à Cotonou  dans la maison de son feu mari KOUCHIKO depuis 14 ans et exerce comme activité la vente des boissons de la SOBEBRA et autres boissons. Son enfant est scolarisé et commerce la première année d'université pour la rentrée académique prochaine. C'est pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant  qu'elle s'est lancé dans cette activité. Elle vient solliciter son cinquième prêt à ALIDé pour élargir son activité et satisfaire au mieux ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès D. was born on December 17, 1957 in Abomey, one of the historic towns of Bénin at Sota in the Arondissement of Sinhoué. She is a widow and the mother of a child named Crédo Kouchiko. She has been living in the Djidjè neighborhood in Cotonou in the home of her late husband Kouchiko for 14 years and works at selling Sobebra and other drinks.

Her child is enrolled in school and beginning his first year in university this fall. It is to support her child that she began this business. She has just requested her 5th loan from Alidé to expand her business and better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10  cases of SOBEBRA drinks and  2 jerry cans of 50 liters each of liquor made from palm wine, etc.

loans.name: Peggy Luz

texts.es:
La señora Peggy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, ubicado en Jr: Bolognesi Nº 224, distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la pesca. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de pescado.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Peggy y su esposo trabajan juntos, además ambos se levantan muy temprano para cumplir con su deber y apoyar a sus queridos hijos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de pescado. Diariamente compran de 2 a 3 bandejas para realizar su actividad.
   
Peggy siente que ha mejorado su estabilidad económica gracias a la ayuda que le brinda el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Peggy is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas” which is located at Jr. Bolognesi No. 224, district of Manantay, in the Ucayali department. She is 23 years old and is the mother of three young children. She is married and her husband works as a fisherman. She invested the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of fish.

She is currently in the same business. Peggy and her husband work together. They both get up very early to do their duty and support their much loved children.

She will invest this loan of $600, which will be repaid in 4 months, in purchasing fish. They buy 2 to 3 trays of fish every day for their business. Peggy feels that she has improved her economic stability thanks to the help that the communal bank Manuela Ramos provides her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of fish.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocío pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr. Las Violetas 8 MzC Lt:1 AA.HH., La Lupuna, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte terrestre, maneja una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y está deseosa y con ganas de seguir  trabajando.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de aceite, 1 caja de leche chica y grande, sal, 1 paquete de fideos, 1 bolsa de detergente y otros.
   
Rocío manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda tanto para ella como para todas aquellas mujeres luchadoras.
texts.en:
La señora Rocío belongs to the community bank "La Lupuna," located in the Jr. Las Violetas 8 MzC Lt:1 AA.HH., La Lupuna, district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 41 years of age and is the mother of two minor children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband works in land transportation, driving a "motokar" (three-wheeled motorized form of transport). With the first loan of S/.300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of groceries.

Currently, she has a store in her home and has the desire to continue working.

With this loan of S/.1,700 ($575), one which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries like one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one package of oil, one box of small and large milk, salt, one package of beans, one bag of detergent and others.

Rocío expresses that Manuela Ramos is such a help for her as it is for all those hard-working women.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.).

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Dame K. Marguérite est née vers 1931 à Porto-Novo, la capitale administrative du Bénin. Actuellement elle est veuve et mère de deux enfants qui sont plus à sa charge. Elle a été le chef quartier de Djidjè où elle vit et vend des condiments depuis 30 ans. C'est pour varier les produits qu'elle vend et satisfaire davantage ses clients qu'elle  sollicite ce prêt. Elle est à son septième prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. Marguérite K. was born around 1931 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Currently, she is a widow and the mother of two children, who are no longer in her care. She has been the district head of Djidjè, where she lives and has been selling condiments for thirty years. Varying the products she sells and satisfying her customers more are the reasons why she is requesting this loan. She is on her seventh loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of corn, a basket of tomatoes, and a drum of peanut oil

loans.name: Akpédjé Atifosé Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 26 juin 1977 à Lomé, Madame S. Akpédjé Atifosé Kossiwa est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de bijoux et de tissus Bazin dans les marchés des quartiers de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et fait ses achats au bénin pour les bijoux et au mali pour les tissus bazin.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. 
Ces derniers temps, elle reçoit plusieurs commandes de ses clients et n’arrive pas à les satisfaire.
Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 50 colliers complets et 20 tissus de Bazin d’origine malienne.
texts.en:
Born on June 26, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Akpédjé Atifosé Kossiwa S. is married and the mother of two children. Her business is selling costume jewelry and "Bazin" (a cloth that is very popular in West Africa) in various markets around Lomé. She began this business in 2001 and buys her costume jewelry in Benin and the "Bazin" in Mali.

She has already had one loan from WAGES that she correctly reimbursed. Recently, she has been getting a number of orders from her customers and is not able to fill them. She is requesting this second loan to buy 50 necklace/earring sets and 20 lengths of "Bazin" from Mali.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of costume jewelry and "bazin" cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Rosario Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr: La Unión Nº 294, distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 3 años participando en Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y también vende comida por las noches. En el negocio de comida se podrá encontrar juanes, salchipapa y otros antojitos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de leche, toallas higiénicas, huevos, papel higiénico, etc., y de esa manera le están dando la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio.  
   
Rosario se siente feliz, porque día a día mejora su negocio, y está muy contenta con todo lo que ha logrado.
texts.en:
La señora Rosario belongs to the community bank "Las Paykanas", located in Jr: La Unión Nº 294, district of Manantay, department of Ucayali. She is 31 years of age, is the mother of three young children that still depend on her, is married, and her husband works in a mechanic's shop. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300, she decided to invest it in the sale of groceries. She has participated in Manuela Ramos for three years.

Currently, she has a store in her home and also sells food at night. In her food business you can find "juanes" (steam cooked rice dough with or without a filling), salchipapa (dish that contains potato and fried sausage), and other snacks.

With this loan of S/.1,200 ($400), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, 1 box of milk, sanitary pads, eggs, toilet paper, etc., and in this way give her the opportunity to increase her business.

Rosario feels happy because day by day her business improves and she is very content with everything that she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sugar, rice, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rusilda

texts.es:
La señora Rusilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº 553, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo conduce su motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 2 años en Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con un lavadero y un motokar, además se dedica a la venta de ceras y aceite de motos y motokar, y por las mañanas, con la ayuda de su hija Liliana, vende caldo, jugos y hamburguesas. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 baldes de aceites, ceras, y frutas, con la cual le brindan la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio.
   
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha mejorado su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Rusilda belongs to the community bank "Las Paykanas", located in Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº 553, district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband drives a "motokar" (three-wheeled motorized form of transport). With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300, she decided to invest in the sale of chickens. She has been with Manuela Ramos for 2 years.

Currently she has a car wash and a motokar, also, she sells wax and oil for motorcycles and motokars, and, in the mornings, with the help of her daughter, Liliana, she sells soups, juices, and hamburgers.

With this loan of S/.1,300 ($450), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy four buckets of oils, waxes, and fruits, which will offer her the opportunity to increase her business.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has improved her business and the economic stability of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy buckets of oil, waxes, and fruit.

loans.name: Narcisa Silvia

texts.es: La señora Narcisa R., tiene 43 años de edad, es casda, tiene dos hijos, la mayor tiene 21 años de edad cursa el tercer años de la carrera de trabajo social en la universidad, y su otro hijo tiene 8 años de edad cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer para la alcaldia municipal de leon, la señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad dando inicio como una herencia de su señora madre quien se dedico a esta actividad tambien, su sueño ha sido poder ampliar y mejorar su condiciones de trabajo ya que ella solo trabaja con una pequeña maquina sencilla de pedal confeccionando delantares, juego de cubre camas, cobertores y fundas, la cual comercializa a personas que tradicionalmente le han comprado, con el financiamiento ella lo utiliza para la compra de materia prima como tela de esta manera ir adquiriendo un poco mas ganancias e ir dandole estudios a sus hijos, pero tiene la esperanza que ira ampliando su pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
Narcisa R. is 43 years old, she is married, has two children, the oldest is 21 years old and is in her third year of university studying to become a social worker, her son is eight years old and is in 3rd grade of elementary school, her husband works as a driver for the municipal government of leon. Narcisa has worked in her business for 25 years; she started with inheritance money from her deceased mother, who also worked in this activity. Her dream is to expand and improve her working conditions, because she only works with a small sewing machine to design and create aprons, bed sets, blankets and covers, which she sells to her usual clients. With the loan she will buy materials such as fabric, this way she will slowly generate more income and provide studies to her children, she hopes to expand her small sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase materials

loans.name: Gnami

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Tchitchao dans la région de la Kara, elle répond au nom de B. Gnami et habite à Lomé. Elle a deux enfants et a pour activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités et des produits de beauté à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1989 ce qui veut dire qu’elle est très expérimentée dans le domaine de commerce. Etant donné qu’elle est la première à s’installer dans son quartier, son ancienneté et son accueille font d’elle une revendeuse reconnue.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé et sollicite ce second pour renforcer son stock par l’achat de 13 cartons de lait, 08 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de boîtes de conserve.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Tchitchao in the Kara region, Gnami B. now lives in Lomé. She has two children and she sells staple goods as well as beauty products in Lomé. She started her business in 1989 and thus has a lot of experience in this field. Given that she was the first to open a business in her neighborhood, her seniority and welcoming nature have made her a well-known merchant. She has taken out a previous loan and repaid it in full. She is requesting this loan so she can increase her stock with the purchase of 13 boxes of milk, eight containers of oil, and 10 boxes of canned goods.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple goods and beauty products

loans.name: Sadith Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Sadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas” ubicado en Jr. Serafín Filomeno Nº 248, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 67 años de edad, es madre de 3 nietos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es soltera y apoya a su hijo mayor que trabaja en el planchando de autos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas.

En la actualidad cuenta con varios negocios, entre ellos tenemos la venta de gaseosas, de hamburguesas, de raspadilla, por las noches vende salchipapas, también brinda el servicio de lavado de ropa ajena, etc. Es una mujer trabajadora e independiente.

Con este préstamo de S/.1.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de un trompo de construcción civil para trabajar con la ayuda de su hijo.
   
Sadith se siente una mujer con mucha fuerza para seguir adelante, agradece de corazón a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a la mujer ucayalina.
texts.en:
Sadith belongs to “Las Brisas” community bank located at No.248 Jr. Serafin Filomeno, district of Calleria, Ucayali.
