She is 67 years old, has three young grandchildren that depend on her, she is single and helps her older son who works as a car detailer. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $100 US (S/.300), she decided to invest in selling food. Currently, she works on different activities, such as selling sodas, burgers, slushy drinks, at night she sells hot dogs with French fries, she also provides laundry services. She is a hardworking and independent woman. With this loan of $500 US (S/.1500), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy construction equipment to work with the help of her son. Sadith feels strong to keep going ahead, she thanks Manuela Ramos from the bottom of her heart for helping the Ucayalin woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction equipment

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Dame B. Victoire est née le 30/06/1960 à Porto-Novo, la capitale administrative du Bénin. Elle est mariée au sieur KPADONOU et est mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle revend les chaussures et sacs usagers de friperie et aussi des bassines, des pagnes et autres. Elle commencé cette activité depuis 7 ans et habite le quartier  Hindé depuis 15 ans. C'est pour faire face à la demande de ses clients qu'elle est venue solliciter pour la cinquième fois un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoire B. was born June 30th, 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. KPADONOU and is the mother of one child who is going to school. She retails shoes, bags of used clothing, as well as basins, cloth, and other wares. She has been doing business for the last seven years in the Hindé neighborhood, where she has also been living for 15 years. She is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDE to meet her customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and used clothing

loans.name: Semira

texts.es:
La señora Semira pertenece al banco comunal “la lupuna”, ubicado en el Jr: Cesar Vallejo Mz.D Lt.6 AA.HH. Cesar Vallejo, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es maestro albañil. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300.00, decide invertir en la venta de ropa.             

En la actualidad, Semira, junto con su esposo, están mandando a construir habitaciones y un baño, lo cual le permitirá tener el negocio “Alquiler de Cuartos”, además se desempeña como docente de inicial y trabaja por las mañanas.  
	
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, comprará 5 tubos, 5 cajas de mayólicas y otros.   

Gracias a Manuela Ramos hizo realidad uno de sus sueños, el cual era tener su propio negocio, lo cual le permitirá apoyar siempre a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Semira belongs to “La Lupuna” community bank, located at Mz. D Lt. 6 AA.HH. Jr. Cesar Valejo, district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali. She is 32, has two dependent children, married and her husband is a construction worker. With the first loan of $100 US (S/.300), she decided to invest in selling clothing. Currently, Semira along with her husband, are building rooms and a bathroom, which will allow them to rent rooms as a business, she also works as a teacher during the morning. With the loan of $500 US (S/. 1,500), to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy construction materials. Thanks to Manuela Ramos she realized one of her dreams of having her own business, which will allow her to support her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Dame A. Akoua est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Wli centre dans la préfecture de Zio. Dans son village natal abondent les céréales surtout le haricot. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses deux petits enfants. Elle a pour activité la restauration de la pâte de maïs et de la pâte d’igname appelée foufou. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2004 et se situe au bord de la route nationale N°1 du Togo. Elle accueille beaucoup de clients et fait beaucoup de recettes.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et 60 tubercules d’ignames. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux servir ses clients et satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akoua A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Wli, in the center of the Prefecture of Zio. In her village of birth, cereals, especially beans are found in abundance. She is divorced and lives with her two little children. Her business is selling cooked food: maize porridge and coco yam porridge called foufou. She began this business in 2004 and sells her food sitting on the side of Togo's National Road Number 1 . She has lots of customers and makes plenty of sales.

She is requesting this first loan to buy 5 sacks of maize and 60 coco yams. With this new stock, she will be able to better serve her customers and support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize and coco yams for food service

loans.name: Vanesa Dortis

texts.es:
La señora Vanesa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr: Pachacutec Mz.1 Lt.1, Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es madre soltera que lucha día a día. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, decide invertir en compra de pollo.

En la actualidad Vanesa continua con el mismo negocio de venta de pollo. Trabaja desde muy temprano para luego dedicarse a cuidar a sus hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará un motokar para así generar mayores ingresos, pagar el préstamo y cumplir con puntualidad.

Vanesa se siente feliz y con mucha fuerzas para seguir adelante. Agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Vanesa belongs to “Las Brisas” community bank, located at Mz.1 Lt.1 Jr. Pachacutec, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 27 years old, has 2 young children that still depend on her, she is a single mom that fights day after day. With the first loan that she received of $100 US (S/.300), she decided to purchase chicken. Currently, Vanesa continues with the same business of selling chicken. She starts working very early to then take care of her children. With the loan of $850 US (S/.2,500), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a motorized cart to generate better income and repay the loan on time. Vanesa feels happy and with lots of strength to keep moving ahead. She thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorized cart

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: Dame B. Rita est née le 28/07/1952 à Djougou, une ville du Nord Bénin. Elle est mariée à AGUEY ZINSOU Marc et est mère de 02 enfants qui sont à leur charge. Elle vend du charbon, d'huile végétale et autres produits de consommation courante depuis cinq ans et habite le quartier Hindé depuis quarante ans. Pour faire face à la demande de ses clients et pour mieux les satisfaire elle sollicite pour la cinquième fois un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. was born 7/28/1952 in Djougou, a city in north Bénin. She is married to Marc Aguey Zinsou and is a mother of two. She has been selling coal, vegetable oil and other everyday consumer goods for five years and has lived in the Hindé area for four years. To meet the demands of her customers and to better satisfy them, she is seeking a loan from Alidé for the fifth time.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of coal, drums of vegetable oil, bags of corn, and misc. everyday products

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es:
La señorita Vianca pertenece al Banco Comunal La Lupuna, ubicado en la Av. Guillermo Lumbrera Mz.B Lt.14 AA.HH Las Begonias, distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00, decide invertir en el arreglo de su copiadora. Trabaja 2 años con Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, estudió enfermería y está realizando sus prácticas profesionales. Usualmente se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 paquete de aceite, 1 caja de leche chica y grande, 2 paquetes de fideos y otros.

Vianca es una señorita que lucha por la vida, además está muy agradecida al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda y gracias a ello se hizo una mujer independiente.
texts.en:
Miss Vianca belongs to the “La Lupuna” community bank, located in Mz B Lt 14 AA. HH Guillermo Lumbrera Ave, Las Begonias, district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali. She is 23 years old and single. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of $100 US (S/. 300), she decided to invest it in fixing her photocopier. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Currently, she has a genetal store in her house, she studied nursing and is currently doing her professional internship. Usually, she gets up really early to carry out her responsibilities. With this loan of $575 (S/. 1,700) which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 sac of rice, 1 package of oil, 1 small and 1 large boxes of milk, 2 packages of pasta and other items. Vianca is a young lady that fights for life, she is also very thankful with the community bank of Manuela Ramos for the help provided because it allowed her to become an independent woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, milk, pasta and others

loans.name: Nimatou

texts.fr: Née à Kara la seconde grande ville du Togo le 31 décembre 1983, dame T. Nimatou est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a pour activité, la vente des céréales dans le marché du quartier Agoè. Elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006 et s’approvisionne dans le village d’Asahoun situé à 70Km au nord de Lomé. Actuellement il y a une réduction du prix du bol de maïs et elle voulait profiter de cette opportunité pour acheter 12 sacs avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite.
texts.en:
Born in Kara, the second largest city in Togo, on December 31, 1983, Ms. Nimatou T. is married and the mother of two children. Her work involves selling grain at the marketplace of the Agoè district. She started working in commerce in 2006 and gets her supplies in the village of Asahoun, located about 70 km north of Lomé. Currently, there is a drop in price of a bowl of corn, and she would like to take advantage of this opportunity to buy 12 sacks using this first loan she is requesting.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 12 sacks of corn

loans.name: Viviana Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Viviana  pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna” ubicado en el Jr: 23 de Febrero Nº 535 Pj Micaela Bastidas, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años, es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.200, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. 

En la actualidad cuenta con un motokar y posee la ayuda de su hermano para  poner a trabajar día a día su herramienta de trabajo, y de esa manera poder pagar puntualmente el préstamo.    

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700 el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de la motokar, para ello comprará 3 llantas, 1 par de telescopios, 4 focos, 1 faro y también invertirá en la educación de su pequeño hijo.
   
Viviana está muy contenta y agradecida porque gracias a Manuela Ramos mejoró su estabilidad económica para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Viviana belongs to “La Lupuna” community bank, located at No.535 Jr. 23 de Febrero PjMicaela Bastidas, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 30, single and has a young son that still depends on her. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of $65 US (S/.200), she decided to invest in selling food. Currently, she has a motorized cart and with the help of her brother they use it as a tool to work with everyday and repay the loan on time. With this $575 US (S/.1,700) loan, to be repaid in 5 months, she will fix the motorized cart and will buy three tires, a pair of reflectors, four lights, 1 headlight and also in the education expenses of her small son. Viviana is very happy and thankful to Manuela Ramos for improving her financial stability for the well being of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix motorized cart

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Ysabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, ubicado en Jr: Lambayeque Nº 175, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, decide invertir en venta de pollo. Tiene 7 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de pollos y ropa. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para salir a vender sus pollos y en las tardes poder ocuparse de su negocio de ropa.  

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de pollo y ropa, comprará de lunes a viernes 50 pollos, sábados y domingos comprará de 80 a 100 pollos y la ropa lo comprará al por mayor tanto  para damas, caballeros y niños.
   
Ysabel manifiesta que gracias a Manuela Ramos desde muy joven se hizo independiente.
texts.en:
Ysabel belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Brisas", located in Jr: Lambayeque Nº 175 in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and is single. With her first loan through which she received S/.300 she decided to invest in chicken sales. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 7 years. At the present time she works selling chickens and clothing. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to go out and sell her chickens and in the afternoons is in her clothing sales business. With this loan of S/.2,000, which will be paid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of chicken and clothing. She will purchase 50 chickens from Monday-Friday, 80-100 chickens on Saturdays and Sundays and she will purchase clothing wholesale for ladies, gentlemen and children. Ysabel says that thanks to Manuela Ramos she became independent from a young age.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of chickens and clothing.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Dame G. Aline est née vers 1980 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. Elle a épousé le sieur AHO Bertrand qui est un entrepreneur. Elle vend du charbon depuis 6 ans et réside à Djidjè un quartier de Cotonou depuis sa naissance. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour faire face à la demande de ses clients qui sont pour leur grande majorité consommateurs de charbon de bois parce que ne disposant pas de gaz domestique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aline G. was born around 1980 in Cotonou in the Littoral Department. She is the mother of two children. She married Mr. Bertrand Aho, who is a businessman. She has been selling charcoal for 6 years and she has lived in Djidjè, a neighborhood of Cotonou, since her birth. She is requesting this loan so that she can keep up with the demand of her customers who use charcoal for the most part because they do not have gas for cooking.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Originaire du célèbre village lacustre de Ganvié, dame H. Léa est née vers 1975 d'une mère revendeuse de poissons et d'un père pêcheur. Elle n'a jamais fréquenté une école. Initiée dès sa tendre enfance à la vente de poissons par sa mère, elle en a fait son activité pour gagner sa vie. Ainsi, achète-t-elle du poisson sur la lagune de Cotonou pour revendre au marché de Gbégamey. Aujourd'hui, elle a pour souci de diversifier un peu son petit commerce. C'est pour cela qu'elle vient demander ce premier prêt  de 100 000 F CFA en vue de vendre du pétrole mais aussi d'augmenter son capital dans la vente de poissons. Elle compte acheter 100 litres de pétrole et compléter le capital de vente du poisson à hauteur de 45 000 F CFA. Mariée au pêcheur TOTIN Joseph, dame H. Léa a six enfants.
texts.en:
Originally from the famous lakeside village of Ganvié, Ms. Léa H. was born around 1975 of a fish-seller mother and a fisherman father. She never attended school. Initiated by her mother at a tender age in selling fish, she has worked at it to earn a living. Thus, she buys fish from the lagoon of Cotonou for resale at the Gbégamey marketplace. Today, she is concerned with diversifying a little her small-scale business. This is why she has come to ask for a loan of 100,000 francs CFA with the goal of selling kerosene but also to increase her capital for selling fish. She intends to buy 100 liters of kerosene and to round out her capital of 45,000 francs for fish-selling. Married to Joseph TOTIN, a fisherman, Ms. Léa H. has six children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 liters of kerosene and fresh fish

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née vers 1981 à Abomey-Calavi d'un père cultivateur et d'une mère productrice de farine de manioc, dame K. Célestine a eu un bref cursus scolaire qui s'arrêta en classe de CE1 du cours primaire (Troisième Année). Elle fut placée près de quelqu'un et n'eut pas la chance d'apprendre un métier. Depuis 15 ans, elle a commencé par vendre du maïs et de la farine de manioc localement appelée "GARI". Aujourd'hui elle veut diversifier  son activité et atteindre de nouveaux clients. Elle sollicite donc un prêt de 100 000 F CFA pour son premier prêt à ALIDé pour acheter  du maïs et de la tomate graine. Dame K. Célestine est mariée au pêcheur TOTIN Lucien qui, à temps partiel est un conducteur de taxi-moto appelé "Zémidjan". Jean et Rosine sont ses deux enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Abomey-Calavi from a father who is a farmer and a mother who sells manioc flour, K. Célestine's scolarity has been short. She stopped going to school when she was in third grade. She did not have a chance to learn any trade. She has been selling corn and "gari" (manioc flour) for the last 15 years. She would like to diversify to attract more customers. This is her first loan with ALIDé , she is requesting 100 000 F CFA to buy corn and tomatoes. K. Célestine is married to TOTIN Lucien who is a fisherman and a part time "Zémidjan" (moto-taxi driver). They have 2 children, Jean and Rosine.

Translated from French by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 6 buckets of corn and 2 baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
El caballero Marvin C. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a la actividad de agricultura atendiéndola en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur y sembrando maíz, sorgo y frijol con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación compuesto por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo.

Hoy en día el señor Marvin ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de obtener un crédito para invertir en la siembra y de igual forma brindar asistencia técnica a los cultivos. Por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y una vez que tenga el dinero invertirá en su actividad de agricultura.
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin Chavarria had dedicated much effort to the business of agriculture in the Southern San Rafael municipality. He plants corn, sorghum (a type of grain) and beans to provide for his wife and little child.

Today, Marvin comes to Ceprodel with the aim of obtaining a loan to invest in planting and cultivating technical assistance. He is very confident that he will be awarded this loan and assures you that the money will be invested for agricultural activities.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural cultivation assistance.

loans.name: Matilde Jacqueline

texts.es:
La dama Matilde A. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido con mucho esfuerzo en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ha llevado el sustento a sus casa de habitación brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos pequeños.

Hoy en día, consciente de la necesidad de invertir en su negocio, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual obtener sus productos para comercializarlos. Es de suma importancia destacar que al ser beneficiada por medio de los créditos logra suplir la pulpería de productos y además lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación en su municipio.
texts.en:
Matilde A. works with much effort in her mini-market business, which is located in her home in the city of Managua in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. Since she began her business she has be able to get ahead and has supported her home providing better living conditions for her two little ones.

Today, conscious of the need to invest in her business, she is seeking the support of Ceprodel to get a loan with which to obtain the products to sell. It is important to point out that through this loan she will be able to stock the mini-market and support her household in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde hace 8 años en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur la señora Patricia E. se dedica a la actividad económica de costurera el cual ha mantenido con sus propios esfuerzos en su casa de habitación.

Es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares y gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel, ha logrado salir adelante y ha proporcionado mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños. Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la señora Patricia requiere invertir en la compra de hilos, telas. Agujas, etc. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para suplir su actividad económica y continuar brindándoles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
For the past 8 years in the city of Managua in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur Mrs. Patricia E. has worked in the economic activity of dressmaking, which she has maintained with her own efforts in her home.

She is the mother of three school aged children and thanks to the support that Ceprodel has provided her she has been able to get ahead and has provided better living conditions for her little ones. Like all businesses in development, Patricia needs to invest in the purchase of thread, fabric, needles etc. For this reason she is seeking the support of Ceprodel through the loans to stock her business and continue providing better living conditions for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La dama Petronila A. se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo al negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su propia casa de habitación brindando todo tipo de productos los cuales son ofrecidos a sus clientes en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

Desde que inició su negocio de pulpería ha mejorado el status de vida de su familia brindándole mejores condiciones a su pequeño hijo para su desarrollo. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual la señora Petronila llega a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para usarlo en la compra de la mercadería para ofrecerla en su pulpería.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos los anteriores créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.
texts.en:
Petronila A. works with much effort on her mini-market business which is located in her own home providing all types of products to her clients in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Since she started her mini-market her family’s quality of life has improved, providing them with better conditions for the development of their young son. Today the reason why Petronila has come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to use it for the purchase of merchandise to offer it in her mini-market.

It is important to point out that she has been characterized as a loyal client of Ceprodel as she has paid off all of her previous loans on time and according to the conditions established.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Tomasa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa B. es una persona muy esforzada que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor las cuales las oferta en su propio hogar de habitación.

Desde hace varios años se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel ya que los ha utilizado para mejorar la condición del negocio por medio de la compra de las gaseosas y por este motivo ha mejorado el bienestar de sus pequeño hijo. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar las gaseosas y así comercializarlas en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Tomasa B. is a very hard working person who has worked selling soft drinks wholesale out of her own home for the past few years.

For the past few years she has been supported by loans provided by Ceprodel and she has used them to improve the condition of her business through the purchase of soft drinks and has improved the well being of her small child. Today the reason which she has gone to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan with which she will purchase the soft drinks and then sell them in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks.

loans.name: Jesús Enma

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Enma R. Benítes tiene cincuenta años, vive en la avenida Los Incas 325 en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa y ya no continua estudiando debido a que sus padres pensaban que era suficiente con la primaria, preferían educar a los hijos hombres ya que ellos servirían a la patria.
Se casó a los veintitrés años y tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno todavía es estudiante, los otros dos ya trabajan.
Empezó su negocio comprando animales y vendiéndolos en carne, así se obtiene mayores ingresos, comenta.
De Manuela Ramos obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300 soles con los que compró animales para venta de carne, los devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con el préstamo que obtendrá de Manuela y será de 1000 soles comprará una ternera la que venderá en carne.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de María, a la Asociación de Padres de Familia del colegio de su hijo y al Banco Comunal Progresistas y en todas sus Instituciones es tesorera.
Sueña con pasear viajar y conocer diversos lugares de Perú y el mundo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesús Enma R. Benítes is 50 years old and lives on Los Incas 325 Avenue in the Mache district of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her primary school education, but did not continue her studies given that her parents thought she’d received enough schooling. They preferred educating their sons, as they would be serving their country. She married at 23 years of age, and had three children. One of her children is still in school, while the other two are now working.

She started her business buying animals and selling their meat which, she tells us, is how she generated greater income for herself. She received a first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, with which she bought animals. She repaid the loan in four months. With this loan from Manuela for 1,000.00 soles, she will buy a calf whose meat she will then sell. She belongs to the Corazón de María dining hall, to the Parents Association at her son’s school, and to the communal bank Progresistas. She serves as Treasurer at all three institutions. She dreams of traveling and getting to know other areas of Perú and the world.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf.

loans.name: Isabel Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  Isabel Margarita L. E.  tiene cuarentaidos años y vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Isabel estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó y tuvo cuatro hijos, se separó de su esposo por falta de comprensión actualmente tiene otra pareja, el señor Walter Carranza y con el tiene un hijo. Tres de sus hijos aun son estudiantes.
El primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con los que compró, quesillo, animales pequeños, trigo y artículos para su bodega. 
Lo importante para ella es que de Manuela Ramos aprendió a tomar sus decisiones por ella misma, le ayudó a ser independiente.
Con este préstamo de 3000 soles, comprará una vaca y un toro, el préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
Ella es fiscal en su Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache al cual pertenece desde hace nueve años aproximadamente, también pertenece al Comedor  Popular María Victoria.
Su gran sueño es tener una casa muy elegante en Trujillo y también una bodega.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel Margarita L. E. is a 32-year-old woman who lives on Primavera Avenue in the Mache district of the Otuzco province in La Libertad Perú. Isabel studied up to her third year in high school, but was unable to finish because she got married and had 4 children. She later divorced her husband due to a lack of mutual understanding. She currently has another partner, Mr. Walter Carranza, with whom she has a son. Three of her children are in school. With the first loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos (300 PEN), she purchased milk curd, small animals, wheat, and other goods for her general store. The important thing for her is that she learned how to make her own decisions thanks to Manuela Ramos, which helped her become independent. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase a cow and a bull. She is an associate in her Mujeres de Mache microfinance institute, of which she has been a member for approximately nine years. She is also a member of the María Victoria soup kitchen. Her greatest dream is to own an elegant house and a general store in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow and a bull

loans.name: Hilda Martha

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Martha García D. S. tiene cincuentainueve años vive en la Avenida Campo Bello sin número del distrito D. Mache D. la provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad.
Cursó hasta el segundo año D. primaria y no continuó por falta D. apoyo económico D. sus padres.
Se casó a los veintitrés años y tiene un hijo que ya se ha casado, ella es viuda.
Su negocio es diverso, compra venD. animales pequeños, fabrica teja, hace diversos bordados y teje hermosas colchas las que venD. en su mismo domicilio.
Su primer préstamo que obtuvo D. Manuela Ramos fue D. 300 soles con los que compró quesillo y animales, poco a poco vio como crecía su negocio.
Con este préstamo D. 800 soles, comprará material para teja y hoja D. eucalipto que es con lo que prenden el fuego para el horno D. teja. Pagará en cuatro meses.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Progresistas. Su gran sueño es tener una casa propia en Mache lugar que le gusta mucho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Martha G. D. S. is fifty-nine years old and lives in the Campo Bello Ave., no number, in the district of Mache in the Otuzo province of the La Libertad department. She studied until 2nd graD. and did not continue her studies due to lack of financial support from her parents. She got married when she was 23 years old and she has a married son. She is a widow. Her business is diverse, she buys and sells small animals, makes tiles, creates diverse embroideries and weaves beautiful blankets which she sells at her home. She obtained her first loan for 300 soles from Manuela Ramos. With this money she bought cheese and animals, and little by little she saw her business grow. With the loan for 800 soles she will buy tile-making materials and eucalyptus leaves, which is what they use to light the fires for the tile-making oven. She will pay in 4 months. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Progresista. Her greatest dream is to own her home in Mache, a place she likes very much.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials and eucalyptus leaves to make tiles.

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La  señora Grimaldina  Z.  tiene 54 años y vive en la calle José Olaya 105 donD. también funciona su negocio, en el distrito D. Mache en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento D. La Libertad.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no siguió estudiando debido a que solamente había primaria en el distrito, además los padres preferían darles educación  completa a los hijos varones.
Grimaldina es madre soltera, tiene un hijo al cual educa y cuida completamente sola, pero ella es una mujer muy valiente.
Cuenta con una bodega donD. venD. golosinas, cerveza y comida.
Con Manuela Ramos obtuvo su primer préstamo D. 300 soles que le fueron D. muchísima utilidad, ya que con eso compro víveres para hacer comida y darles pensión a los profesores que en ese tiempo no tenían donD. comer, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos televisores e instalará una sala D. juego D. nintendo.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular D. su barrio y al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo, ella es la presidenta.
Su gran sueño es poner cabinas D. Internet y hacer que su Mache avance cada día más.
texts.en:
Grimaldina Z. is 54 years old and lives at 105 Jose Olaya Street where she also runs her business, in the Mache district, in the Otuzco province, in the Libertad department.

She completed elementary school, however she did not continue her studies as elementary school was only available in her area. In addition, parents preferred to educate male children completely.

Grimaldina is a single mother. She has a son who she took care of and educated completely on her own. She is a very brave woman.

She has a shop where she sells candy, beer and food. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles through Manuela Ramos. It was very useful since with it she purchased food to make meals and gave pensions to teachers who, at that time, had nowhere to eat. She repaid her loan in four months.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy televisions and install a Nintendo game room.

She belongs to the Comedor Popular (soup kitchen) in her neighborhood and she is the president of the Working Women Community Bank.

Her greatest dream is to install Internet stalls and ensure that Mache advances every day.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two televisions.

loans.name: Martha Elvira

texts.es:
Martha Elvira es originaria de Cd. Solidaridad, Monterrey, Nuevo León, y se dedica a la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza. <

> Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$300 a un plazo de tres meses con la finalidad de realizar el pago al proveedor del catálogo de productos que ella ofrece. <

> Martha Elvira se inició en las ventas por catálogo para poder enfrentar la separación de su esposo y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus cuatro pequeños hijos. Ella comenta que una persona que le gusta enfretar los retos y salir adelante, prueba de ello es que las ventas le están funcionando y ha obtenido buenos resultados. <

>. ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Martha ya que es una persona que ha demostrado su fuerza por salir adelante! <

>
texts.en:
Martha Elvira from the city of Solidaridad, Monterrey, Nuevo Leon makes a living by selling beauty products from a catalog. Currently, she is asking for a loan of USD $300 for a period of three months with the intent to pay the supplier of the catalog of products she offers. Martha Elvira began selling from the catalog because of her separation from her husband and in this way, meet the needs of her four small children. She comments that she is a person who likes to confront challenges and move forward; proof of this is that she has had success in sales and has obtained good results. I invite you to join us to help Martha who is a person that has demonstrated her strength to move forward!

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the supplier of catalog products

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes tiene 55 años de edad,  es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven ha trabajo en la venta de cosméticos  lo cual fue un comienzo como comerciante,  e inició con fondos propios, ella habita en un barrio llamado el Pilar de la ciudad de Managua, tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como contador. Doña Mercedes logro poner una pulpería hace trece años, su dificultad ha sido falta de capital para crecer mas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en capital de productos para la pulpería pues quiere surtir de toda variedad de productos para tener una mejor oferta hacia sus clientes. Espera poder seguir ampliando el negocio hasta convertirlo en una miscelánea que es el mayor anhelo de Doña Mercedes
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes is 55 years old. She is a fighting woman. From a very young age she has worked selling cosmetics. This was her start as a businesswoman, and she began with her own funds. She lives in a neighborhood called Pilar, in the city of Managua. She has a 17 year old son and is married. Her husband works very hard as an accountant. Doña Mercedes began a paper store three years ago. Her biggest challenge has been a lack of capitol that keeps the business from growing larger. With the help of this loan, that will be invested in an inventory of products for the paperstore, she wants to stock a large variety of products in order to have a better selection for her clients. She hopes to be able to continue growing her business until she can change it into a variety store. This is the biggest dream of Doña Mercedes.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in products for a paperstore

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: Wilder habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Anexo a Jonathan González, tiene 39 años de edad,  su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad que están estudiando la secundaria. Don Wilder tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años y también tiene una sala de video juegos, lo cual logro formar  con fondos propios, pues comenzó solo vendiendo golosinas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la pulpería en comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, verduras y así ofrecer a sus clientes variedad, así como también captar otros clientes. Su mayor anhelo es convertir a sus hijos en profesionales y por eso seguirá trabajando fuertemente.
texts.en:
Wilder lives in the Anexo a Jonathan Gonzalez neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is 39 years old and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children; a 14 year old and 16 year old who are in high school. Wilder has a grocery store and an arcade which he established with his own funds by initially selling candies. This loan will be used to invest in the grocery store by purchasing basic grains, dairy products and vegetables in order to offer their clients greater variety and to bring in other clients. His greatest wish is that their children will become professionals which is why he will continue working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, dairy products and vegetables.

loans.name: Gladis Daysi

texts.es: La Sra. Gladis habita en un barrio llamado Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres de 14 y 17 años de edad, y un varón de 5 años de edad, que están cursando la primaria, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica al comercio. El negocio de doña Gladis es la venta de verduras, pan y refrescos, son diecisiete años de experiencia en ventas, e inició con fondos propios. Empezó comprando y vendiendo chatarras, al principio la vendía en un carretón a caballo, luego con las ganancias compro una camioneta y cambio de actividad ya que el pan se vende diario y las verduras también. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda en la  compra de  cerámica y cemento para el piso, y así poder tener una vivienda más digna para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación, she has three children, two daughters ages 14 and 17 and one son age 5 who is in primary school. She is 34 years old, married, and her husband is also in business. Gladis sells vegetables, bread and beverages, and has 17 years of experience in sales, beginning with her own savings. She began buying and selling scrap metal, at first selling it from a cart pulled by a horse; then with the earnings she bought a small truck and changed to daily selling bread and vegetables. With the loan she will make improvements to her home by buying ceramic and cemement for the floor, thereby being able to have a home more fit for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic and cement for the floor of her home

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny C., 45, is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Bouy Morn, is a construction worker. They live in Snam Preah Commune in the Pursat Province. Ny has five children: Three work as construction workers and two are studying. Ny grows rice in the rainy season every year and that crop is the main income in her family. To increase her rice yield, Ny would like to request a loan of US $400 to purchase fertilizer, pay for plowing her farmland, and to hire people to transplant rice seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy K., aged 49, is married and works with her husband, Soam Kean, 48, to grow rice and rear pigs. On average, she makes around US$2.50 in profits each day. Farming has become increasingly difficult as the weather is unreliable and inflation is spiralling upwards this year. This couple has five children, one of whom is married and four others who are employed in different industries. 

Soy is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a cow to help plow her farm, and to purchase more pigs. 

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor as well as small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow her farm, as well as more pigs to rear

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sophorn K., 35, is a housewife who stays home to provide child care and to cook food for her family. Her husband, Mr. In Pov, 38, is a motorcycle taxi driver as well as a Cambodian soldier. They live in Chiro II Commune, Kampong Cham Province and have three children, all of whom are students and living at home. Currently, her husband's income is declining because his old motorcycle is not attractive. Sophorn is requesting a US $800 loan so her husband can buy a motorcycle that attracts more customers. This will improve her husband's business and increase the family's income because it is the main source of income in her family.

loans.use: To buy her husband a new motorcycle to attract more taxi customers

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mr. Nget T. is a villager in Prey Run Village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, he cultivates rice, while he grows vegetables in the dry season. 

Now, it is the rainy season, so he wants to cultivate rice; unfortunately, he does not have animals to plow so he needs to hire a laborer with oxen to plow. Thus, Mr. Nget T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support his field . 

His wife, Mrs. Mao Eom, helps him in the plantation. Mr. Nget T. has two children who are both construction workers. They can earn $3 a day each. His wife and son are shown with Mr. Nget T..

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Kruoch

texts.en: Mrs. Kruoch V. is a farmer in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to work in the field. Therefore, Mrs. Kruoch V. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer in order to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Thou Peat, owns a small store where he sells fruit in the local village. Mrs. Kruoch V. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to work in the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Mrs. Meach R. was born in 1956. She lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending school. Mrs. Meach R. is a farmer. The soil in her rice field is poor, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is a villager in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder.  

She usually sells her pigs after four months when they are big enough to sell. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to purchase more pig food to feed them. 

Her husband, Mr. Hon Hai, is a construction worker who does not make enough income to support his family. Mrs. Srey S. is 34 years old and the mother of two children -- one is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy five piglets for breeding and more pig food.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Chhin S. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She is a farmer in Pres Leu Village in Takeo Province. 

On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers in order to support her rice field to make her crop more productive. 

Mrs. Chhin S. usually sells her rice in January for a profit. Mrs. Chhin S. is a 59-year-old widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mrs. Chhin S. obtained $150 from AMK, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Vot

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Vot L. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She is a pig breeder in Pres Leu Village in Takeo Province. 

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food for her pigs.

 Aside from this business, she is a farmer and grocer. Mrs. Vot L. is a 54-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her child can earn $87 per month, which it is sill too little income to support the household.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
This the second time Mr. Nuon Y. has asked to take out a loan in order to improve his living conditions. He is a farmer in Pres Leu Village in Takeo Province. 

On his plantation, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy one more ox to add to the old one in order to plow his rice field. Therefore, Mr. Nuon Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox. With the remaining part of the loan he would buy fertilizers to support his crop in order to make it more productive. 

His wife, Mrs. Some Art, helps him on the plantation. With his rice crop in 2007, Mrs. Nuon Y. got $750 in income that year. Mr. Nuon Y. is 43 years old and the father of two children -- one is employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy one more ox to add to the old one in order to plow his rice field and fertilizers.

loans.name: Port

texts.en:
Mrs. Port H. is a villager in Pres Leu Village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then resell later at a better price. 

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her business activity. Mrs. Port H. is a 62-year-old widow with a child who assists her on the plantation. Mrs. Port H. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock and then resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem S. is a farmer in Phlov Village in Takeo Province. 

On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field now is infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Hem Choeurn, is a retired soldier who can get a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Soem S. is 42 years old and the mother of six children -- two are employed in a garment factory while the other three help their mother on the plantation. The youngest one is attending school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall S. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer but the soil in her rice field is poor. Therefore, Mrs. Phall S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop. She is a 48-year-old widow with three children one of whom owns a small grocery store in the local market while the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S. was born in 1949. She lives in Prey Run Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer but her rice plantation now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field. Mrs. Sin S. is a widow with two children one of whom is a farmer and the other is a laborer who digs wells.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Mrs. Uon Y. lives in Andoung Samreth Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Keng Korng, are farmers. They have four children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Even though the family members have different business activities, they still cannot support their family well so Mrs. Uon decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding in order to improve her living conditions. She hopes to increase her income with this loan. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Mrs. Orm E. was born in 1970, and she now lives in Phngeas Village in Takeo Province. 

She is a farmer who faces a small problem because her plantation field now is infertile soil. In order to solve this obstacle, Mrs. Orm E. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fertilizers to support her field in order to make it more productive. 

Mrs. Orm E. is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her child can earn $87 per month to support the household.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field and make it more productive.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo N. is a farmer in Trapaing Run Village in Takeo Province. 

On her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil. To solve this problem, Mrs. Keo N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Horm Chhuon, is policeman in the provincial town, and he can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Keo N. is 43 years old and the mother of eight children -- four are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Mr. Pom N. is a farmer in Phnom Lontais Village in Takeo Province. His wife, Mrs. Tun Saron, is a primary teacher who does not make enough income to support the family. 

Aside for these businesses, Mr. Pom N. and his wife own a rice mill in their house, and they can make an income from it. Although they have separate businesses, they are still in poor conditions. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Pom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Mr. Pom N. is 54 years old and the father of a child who is attending school. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S. lives in Pongro Village in Takeo Province. She is 26 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study right now.

Mrs Sam is a poultry breeder who raises ducks for eggs. Since her business is doing well, she plans to expand it by buying another 200 ducks for breeding. Each duck costs $2.50, so she is requesting $500 to achieve this goal. 

Her husband, Mr. Vith Sao, is a farmer and also assists his wife with her business.

loans.use: To buy 200 ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Mrs. Hy S. is a vegetable farmer in Trapaing Run Village in Takeo Province. Her crops have been damaged by animals because her field does not have a fence to protect it. Thus, Mrs. Hy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to build a fence around her field. Mrs. Hy S. is a 48-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other one is attending school.

loans.use: To build a fence around her field.

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Mrs. Huot N. is a villager in Andoung Samreth Village in Takeo Province. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the others are currently too young to study or work. 

She and her husband (on the left in the picture) are farmers. They need to cultivate rice in the rainy season but unfortunately find this challenging because they do not have enough animals to plow the rice field.

Therefore, Mrs Huot has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Y., 24, sells fruit in the market, while her husband, Mr. Reab Samat, is a blacksmith as well as a musician for a radio station and a French school in Orchar Commune Battambang Province. Phan has two young children at home. Phan buys fruit from farmers and sells it in the town market, earning US $2.00 per day. Phan and her husband discussed how to expand his business. Phan decided to request a loan of US $800 to build a blacksmith shop and to buy charcoal to use for it. This will increase her family's income because her husband's work is the main source of income in the family.

loans.use: To build a blacksmith shop and to buy charcoal to use in it

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sharifa J. from Mwanza. She is married with six children between the ages of 3-15. Sharifa has been running a cereal business since 2006, selling rice, maize, flour, and beans. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sharifa currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$350 in order to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Sharifa thanks you for her support!
                                            
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Edina C. from Mwanza She is married with five children between the ages of 14 to 22. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans. Edina has been running a flower business since 2003. She plants and grows flowers and trees and sells them. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Edina currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$875 to buy seeds and plants. In the future, she plans to plant more flowers and trees. Edina thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and plants

loans.name: Umrijon

texts.en:
Umrijon R. is a very hardworking woman. She is married with two children. She knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. Umrijon cultivates rice to sell at the market. She also raises animals for sale. These activities have given her feelings of satisfaction because they allow her to provide for a considerable portion of the household income.

Her husband is a construction worker and his salary helps cover the family expenses. But his work requires him to be on site, away from home, so Umrijon has to take care of everything. She has to wisely manage the money she earns from rice and cattle sales to cover the increasing expenses of her family. She also makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother. She’s very dedicated to lovingly raising her two children, who help care for the animals and land during their free time.

Umrijon is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) for the term of twelve months to buy small cattle in order to expand her business. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life through dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Tulkinjon

texts.en: Tulkinjon B. is 36 years old. He is married with three children. Tulkinjon provides taxi services with his car. He has been engaged in this work for more than six years. The current business is the main source of income for his large family. In addition to his children and wife, he is also supporting his parents and brothers. Tulkinjon has told us that this type of work requires a lot of effort. In order to obtain a decent wage, he has to work at night, particularly in the early morning hours. He gets up early and goes to bed late trying not to miss any clients. Tulkinjon has no higher education, but he dreams for his children and younger brothers to get it. For that, now Tulkinjon is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher-quality services and thereby earn more in order to support his younger brothers in their higher education. With this purpose, today Tulkinjon requests 3400 Somoni ($1,000) for a term of 10 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Tulkinjon’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en: Shukur R. is 48 years old. He is married with two children. Shukur is very diligent and hard-working. With his car he provides taxi services inside the city of Khujand. For the last twenty years, the current business had been the main income for the family, allowing Shukur to improve the living conditions of his many relatives. In addition to his wife and children, he is also supporting his parents. Like any business, Shukur's taxi also requires some investments from time to time; now the car needs thorough repairs. For this purpose, Shukur requests 3300 Somoni ($975) for the term of 12 months. Having proved himself as a reliable client, Shukur promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en: Abdurasul S. is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children. Abdurasul has a minivan and provides transportation services within the city of Khujand. By maintaining this business for 12 years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car, but in time he saved money and bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Abdurasul’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. However, the business needs some funding, as Abdurasul is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher-quality services in the future. Today Abdurasul needs to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of the minivan. For this purpose, he requests 3400 Somoni ($1,000) for the term of 10 months. As a client of IMON for several years already, Abdurasul had demonstrated himself to be a reliable client. He thanks all the lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Edith M. from Mwanza She is married with four children between the ages of 16 to 24. Edith has been selling children's clothing since 2003.  She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week. Edith currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$350 to buy more clothing. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory. Edith thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Diana M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, aged two and four. Diana has been running a grocery business since 2001 where she sells soda, rice, vouchers, sugar, soap, flour, and cooking oil. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week. Diana currently earns about US$450 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$450 to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Diana thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flours, cooking oil, rice

loans.name: Thi Huan's Group

texts.vi:
Cô C. Thị Thân 48 tuổi mã số 13050021 cô cùng cả nhóm đã tham gia được 1 C. kỳ vay vốn và đã hoàn trả hết. Nay cô làm đơn xin vay 4704.000đ thời hạn là 12 tháng để mua cám nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Bây giờ trong C.ồng nhà cô có gần 1000 con gà đẻ trứng.Ngoài ra hàng ngày cô còn lấy thêm trứng để cho chồng bán cho các đại lý ngoài Hà Nội. hai con cô còn đang đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình cô mỗi ngày từ 200.000đ- 250.000đ. cô trả tuần tốt và nuôi con ăn học. Trong nhóm cô còn có 4 thành viên khác cũng tham gia vau vốn.

  • Tô Thị Vụ 41 tuổi mã số 13050022 vay 4.256.000đ thời gian 12 tháng để mua cám và lợn giống. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn làm nghề hàn xì thu nhập cũng có từ 100.000- 150.000đ / ngày.
  • C. thị Chén 57 tuổi mã số 13050023 vay 2.016.000đ để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. hàng ngày cô đi chợ bán chám- một loại quả dùng kho thịt rát ngon. Mùa nào thì cô bán thứ đó. Thu nhập của gia đình cô khá ổn định.
  • C. Thị Hợi 37 tuổi mã số 13050024 vay 4.256.000đ chị vay vốn để buôn các loại trứng bán hàng ngày, C.̉ yếu là chị giao cho các quán ăn. Thu nhập mỗi ngày cũng được khoảng 100.000đ.
  • Trần Thị Bích 33 tuổi mã số 13050026 vay 4.256.000đ thời gian là 12 tháng chị vay vốn về mua gạo để làm mỳ. thu nhập cưa gia đình chị không cao chỉ 150.000 / ngày đủ để chi tiêu và nuôi 2 cháu ăn học . số còn lại chị trả tuần và dành dụm thêm vốn để mở rộng kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Ms. C. Thị Thân, 48 years old, no 13050021. Her group has already participated T. one round of financing and has fully paid it back. This time, she applies for a loan of 4.704.000đ over 12 months, in order T. buy feed and raise egg-laying chicken. She currently takes care of about 1000 chicken in her enclosure at home. Besides, her husband sells the eggs T. various companies outside of Hà Nội. She has two school-age children. The family's income is around 200.000đ-250.000đ per day. There are 4 other borrowing members in her group.

  • Tô Thị Vụ, 41 years old, no 13050022, borrowing 4.256.000đ over 12 months T. buy animal feed and pigs. Her family's income is around 100.000-150.000đ per day.
  • C. thị Chén, 57 years old, no 13050023, borrowing 2.016.000đ T. buy pig feed. She also goes every day T. the market T. sell chám - a very delicious type of fruit. She sells other products according T. the season. Her family's income has stabilized well.
  • C. Thị Hợi, 37 years old, no 13050024, borrowing 4.256.000đ T. buy and resell all kinds of eggs every day. She serves mainly restaurants. Her daily income reaches around 100.000đ.
  • Trần Thị Bích, 33 years old, no 13050026, borrowing 4.256.000đ over 12 months T. buy flour T. make noodles. The family's income is not high, merely 150.000đ per day, but enough for her T. support two children. The remainder pays back the loan and is kept aside T. further T. extend the business.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicken and animal feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Elizabeth K. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 13 to 20. Elizabeth has been running a grocery business since 2004. She sells maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and sugar. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Elizabeth currently earns about US$250 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$450 to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Elizabeth thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom M. is 45 years old. He is married with 4 children. Gulom is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Gulom has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years. He draws on his personal strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-intensive job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to repair his family's house and save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900), which he has committed to repay within 18 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Gulom appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Adiles B.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year old Adiles B. M.. She is married with four children, aged between 10 and 25 years old. She also cares for another dependent, who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2003, Adiles started a business selling rice, which is open six days a week for five to eight hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Adiles requires a loan in order to buy more stock of rice. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment, a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice.

loans.name: Oria S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Oria S..  She is not married and has no children. In 2005, Oria began selling cosmetics. She opens her business 7 days a week, 9-12 hours a day. Oria requires a loan to buy more inventory. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: Mrs. Soeung L., 46, sells a variety of grocery products and earns US $2.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ngok Hov, 40, is a motorcycle taxi driver. They live in Orchar Commune, Battambang Province, and have five children, all of whom are studying in school and living in the family home. They have discussed increasing their income. Facing the obstacle of lacking capital, L. requested a Kiva loan of US $400 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to replace her husband's old one for his business and to use the rest to stock more groceries to sell. The loan will enable them to increase their income to sustain her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's business and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Thị Thu Lê Group

texts.vi:
Cô Lê Thị Thu mã số 09010001 cô cùng cả nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn được 1 chu kỳ và chuẩn bị vay chu kỳ 2. Cô là một phụ nữ đảm đang và tháo vát. gia đình cô có 6 người. Cô vay 4.704.000 về để mua nguyên liệu làm bánh như đỗ , gạo.. Gia đình cô chủ yếu nhận gói bánh trưng thuê cho các đám cưới, hay cỗ. Ngoài ra cô còn nhận cung cấp chim, gà quay cho các đám phục vụ bà con trong vùng. con gái cô ngoài việc đi học còn giúp cô bán hàng nước như nước mía, nước chè..Thu nhập của cả gioa đình cũng được từ 200.000đ- 250.000đ. Cô rát thích vay của bình minh vì trả góp thật thuận tiện.

Trong nhóm còn co 5 thành viên khác như:
  • Lê Danh Dị mã số 09010011 vay 4.704.000 thời gian 12 tháng để mua gà giông và chim giống để nuôi.
  • Lê Duy Sơn mã số 09010013 vay 4256.000 thời gian vay là 12 tháng để sửa chuồng và mua bò giống
  • Lê Thị Nhàn mã số 09010004 vay 4.4704.000đ thời gian 12 tháng để thêm vốn mở rộng mua hang tạp hóa vè bán
  • H. Thị Mai mã số 09010003 vay 4.704.000đ thời gian 12 tháng để thêm vốn mua chè bán.
  • Vũ Thi Hoa mã số 09010002 vay 4.704.000đ để mua lợn giống
texts.en:
Ms. Lê Thị Thu, no 09010001. Her group already received a first round of loan and is now applying for a second round. She is a hard-working woman. Her family comprises of 6 peopL.. She would like to borrow 4.704.000đ to buy supplies to produce cakes. Her family produces mainly for weddings. Besides, she also takes care of birds & chicken for local peopL.. Her daughter goes to school and besides helps to sell drinks like sugar cane juice and syrups. The family's income is around̀ 200.000đ- 250.000đ. She finds the repayment conditions of the loan quite convenient.

There are 5 other borrowing members in the group:
  • Lê Danh Dị, no 09010011, borrowing 4.704.000đ over 12 months to buy and raise chicken and pigeons.
  • Lê Duy Sơn, no 09010013, borrowing 4.256.000đ over 12 months to repair the enclosure and buy cows.
  • Lê Thị Nhàn, no 09010004, borrowing 4.4704.000đ over 12 months to expand her grocery store.
  • H. Thị Mai, no 09010003, borrowing 4.704.000đ over 12 months to buy and sell desserts.
  • Vũ Thi Hoa, no 09010002, borrowing 4.704.000đ to buy pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for cakes and selling drinks

loans.name: Joyce I.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Joyce M..  She is not married and has one child, aged 1. In 2003, Joyce established her crops business. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Sairiniso

texts.en:
Sairiniso is 52 years old. She is a widow who raised her husband’s son (from his first marriage) alone. Thanks to her effort, he is now married with two children. 

Sairiniso has had a business baking Tajikistan's national sweets from granulated sugar for 16 years. Because her daughter-in-law is now helping her, she wants to expand her business. She doesn’t have enough capitol to meet customer demand. She is therefore asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 12 months. 

With this loan, she is planning to purchase the necessary products to bake the national sweets. She will be able to earn more, improve her living, and ensure the best future for her grandchildren. With your help this will be possible. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams come reality.

loans.use: To purchase of the necessary products for baking the national sweets.

loans.name: Sarah S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 60-year-old Sarah M..  She is a widow and has three children, aged 26, 36, and 40. In 2005, Sarah began poultry farming. She opens her business 7 days a week and works 16 hours a day. Sarah has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bulk feed and medications for her chickens. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.
